DEDICATION To His Highness Prince Alfonso Serafino di Porcia .
[DEDICATION/VB, To/TO, His/PRP$, Highness/NNP, Prince/NNP, Alfonso/NNP, Serafino/NNP, di/NNP, Porcia/NNP, ./.]

Allow me to place your name at the beginning of an essentially Parisian work , thought out in your house during these latter days .
[Allow/VB, me/PRP, to/TO, place/VB, your/PRP$, name/NN, at/IN, the/DT, beginning/NN, of/IN, an/DT, essentially/RB, Parisian/JJ, work/NN, ,/,, thought/VBN, out/RP, in/IN, your/PRP$, house/NN, during/IN, these/DT, latter/JJ, days/NNS, ./.]

Is it not natural that I should offer you the flowers of rhetoric that blossomed in your garden , watered with the regrets I suffered from home-sickness , which you soothed , as I wandered under the boschetti whose elms reminded me of the Champs-Elysees ?
[Is/VBZ, it/PRP, not/RB, natural/JJ, that/IN, I/PRP, should/MD, offer/VB, you/PRP, the/DT, flowers/NNS, of/IN, rhetoric/NN, that/WDT, blossomed/VBD, in/IN, your/PRP$, garden/NN, ,/,, watered/VBD, with/IN, the/DT, regrets/NNS, I/PRP, suffered/VBD, from/IN, home-sickness/NNS, ,/,, which/WDT, you/PRP, soothed/VBD, ,/,, as/IN, I/PRP, wandered/VBD, under/IN, the/DT, boschetti/NN, whose/WP$, elms/NNS, reminded/VBD, me/PRP, of/IN, the/DT, Champs-Elysees/NNP, ?/.]

Thus , perchance , may I expiate the crime of having dreamed of Paris under the shadow of the Duomo , of having longed for our muddy streets on the clean and elegant flagstones of Porta-Renza .
[Thus/RB, ,/,, perchance/RB, ,/,, may/MD, I/PRP, expiate/VB, the/DT, crime/NN, of/IN, having/VBG, dreamed/VBN, of/IN, Paris/NNP, under/IN, the/DT, shadow/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Duomo/NNP, ,/,, of/IN, having/VBG, longed/VBN, for/IN, our/PRP$, muddy/JJ, streets/NNS, on/IN, the/DT, clean/JJ, and/CC, elegant/JJ, flagstones/NNS, of/IN, Porta-Renza/NNP, ./.]

When I have some book to publish which may be dedicated to a Milanese lady , I shall have the happiness of finding names already dear to your old Italian romancers among those of women whom we love , and to whose memory I would beg you to recall your sincerely affectionate DE BALZAC .
[When/WRB, I/PRP, have/VBP, some/DT, book/NN, to/TO, publish/VB, which/WDT, may/MD, be/VB, dedicated/VBN, to/TO, a/DT, Milanese/NNP, lady/NN, ,/,, I/PRP, shall/MD, have/VB, the/DT, happiness/NN, of/IN, finding/VBG, names/NNS, already/RB, dear/RB, to/TO, your/PRP$, old/JJ, Italian/JJ, romancers/NNS, among/IN, those/DT, of/IN, women/NNS, whom/WP, we/PRP, love/VBP, ,/,, and/CC, to/TO, whose/WP$, memory/NNS, I/PRP, would/MD, beg/VB, you/PRP, to/TO, recall/VB, your/PRP$, sincerely/RB, affectionate/JJ, DE/NN, BALZAC/NN, ./.]

July 1838 .
[July/NNP, 1838/NNP, ./.]

SCENES FROM A COURTESAN 'S LIFE ESTHER HAPPY ; OR , HOW A COURTESAN CAN LOVE In 1824 , at the last opera ball of the season , several masks were struck by the beauty of a youth who was wandering about the passages and greenroom with the air of a man in search of a woman kept at home by unexpected circumstances .
[SCENES/NNP, FROM/NNP, A/NNP, COURTESAN/NNP, 'S/VBZ, LIFE/NNP, ESTHER/NNP, HAPPY/NNP, ;/:, OR/NNP, ,/,, HOW/NNP, A/NNP, COURTESAN/NNP, CAN/NNP, LOVE/NNP, In/IN, 1824/CD, ,/,, at/IN, the/DT, last/JJ, opera/NN, ball/NN, of/IN, the/DT, season/NN, ,/,, several/JJ, masks/NNS, were/VBD, struck/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, beauty/NN, of/IN, a/DT, youth/NN, who/WP, was/VBD, wandering/VBG, about/IN, the/DT, passages/NNS, and/CC, greenroom/NN, with/IN, the/DT, air/NN, of/IN, a/DT, man/NN, in/IN, search/NN, of/IN, a/DT, woman/NN, kept/VBD, at/IN, home/NN, by/IN, unexpected/JJ, circumstances/NNS, ./.]

The secret of this behavior , now dilatory and again hurried , is known only to old women and to certain experienced loungers .
[The/DT, secret/NN, of/IN, this/DT, behavior/NN, ,/,, now/RB, dilatory/JJ, and/CC, again/RB, hurried/VBN, ,/,, is/VBZ, known/VBN, only/RB, to/TO, old/JJ, women/NNS, and/CC, to/TO, certain/JJ, experienced/JJ, loungers/NNS, ./.]

In this immense assembly the crowd does not trouble itself much to watch the crowd ; each one 's interest is impassioned , and even idlers are preoccupied .
[In/IN, this/DT, immense/JJ, assembly/NN, the/DT, crowd/NN, does/VBZ, not/RB, trouble/VB, itself/PRP, much/JJ, to/TO, watch/VB, the/DT, crowd/NN, ;/:, each/DT, one/NN, 's/POS, interest/NN, is/VBZ, impassioned/VBN, ,/,, and/CC, even/RB, idlers/NNS, are/VBP, preoccupied/VBN, ./.]

The young dandy was so much absorbed in his anxious quest that he did not observe his own success ; he did not hear , he did not see the ironical exclamations of admiration , the genuine appreciation , the biting gibes , the soft invitations of some of the masks .
[The/DT, young/JJ, dandy/NN, was/VBD, so/RB, much/RB, absorbed/VBN, in/IN, his/PRP$, anxious/JJ, quest/NN, that/IN, he/PRP, did/VBD, not/RB, observe/VB, his/PRP$, own/JJ, success/NN, ;/:, he/PRP, did/VBD, not/RB, hear/VB, ,/,, he/PRP, did/VBD, not/RB, see/VB, the/DT, ironical/JJ, exclamations/NNS, of/IN, admiration/NN, ,/,, the/DT, genuine/JJ, appreciation/NN, ,/,, the/DT, biting/JJ, gibes/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, soft/JJ, invitations/NNS, of/IN, some/DT, of/IN, the/DT, masks/NNS, ./.]

Though he was so handsome as to rank among those exceptional persons who come to an opera ball in search of an adventure , and who expect it as confidently as men looked for a lucky coup at roulette in Frascati 's day , he seemed quite philosophically sure of his evening ; he must be the hero of one of those mysteries with three actors which constitute an opera ball , and are known only to those who play a part in them ; for , to young wives who come merely to say , `` I have seen it , '' to country people , to inexperienced youths , and to foreigners , the opera house must on those nights be the palace of fatigue and dulness .
[Though/XX, he/XX, was/XX, so/XX, handsome/XX, as/XX, to/XX, rank/XX, among/XX, those/XX, exceptional/XX, persons/XX, who/XX, come/XX, to/XX, an/XX, opera/XX, ball/XX, in/XX, search/XX, of/XX, an/XX, adventure/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, who/XX, expect/XX, it/XX, as/XX, confidently/XX, as/XX, men/XX, looked/XX, for/XX, a/XX, lucky/XX, coup/XX, at/XX, roulette/XX, in/XX, Frascati/XX, 's/XX, day/XX, ,/XX, he/XX, seemed/XX, quite/XX, philosophically/XX, sure/XX, of/XX, his/XX, evening/XX, ;/XX, he/XX, must/XX, be/XX, the/XX, hero/XX, of/XX, one/XX, of/XX, those/XX, mysteries/XX, with/XX, three/XX, actors/XX, which/XX, constitute/XX, an/XX, opera/XX, ball/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, are/XX, known/XX, only/XX, to/XX, those/XX, who/XX, play/XX, a/XX, part/XX, in/XX, them/XX, ;/XX, for/XX, ,/XX, to/XX, young/XX, wives/XX, who/XX, come/XX, merely/XX, to/XX, say/XX, ,/XX, ``/XX, I/XX, have/XX, seen/XX, it/XX, ,/XX, ''/XX, to/XX, country/XX, people/XX, ,/XX, to/XX, inexperienced/XX, youths/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, to/XX, foreigners/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, opera/XX, house/XX, must/XX, on/XX, those/XX, nights/XX, be/XX, the/XX, palace/XX, of/XX, fatigue/XX, and/XX, dulness/XX, ./XX]

To these , that black swarm , slow and serried -- coming , going , winding , turning , returning , mounting , descending , comparable only to ants on a pile of wood -- is no more intelligible than the Bourse to a Breton peasant who has never heard of the Grand livre .
[To/TO, these/DT, ,/,, that/DT, black/JJ, swarm/NN, ,/,, slow/JJ, and/CC, serried/JJ, --/:, coming/VBG, ,/,, going/VBG, ,/,, winding/VBG, ,/,, turning/VBG, ,/,, returning/VBG, ,/,, mounting/VBG, ,/,, descending/VBG, ,/,, comparable/VBG, only/RB, to/TO, ants/NNS, on/IN, a/DT, pile/NN, of/IN, wood/NN, --/:, is/VBZ, no/DT, more/RBR, intelligible/JJ, than/IN, the/DT, Bourse/FW, to/TO, a/DT, Breton/NNP, peasant/NN, who/WP, has/VBZ, never/RB, heard/VBN, of/IN, the/DT, Grand/NNP, livre/NN, ./.]

With a few rare exceptions , men wear no masks in Paris ; a man in a domino is thought ridiculous .
[With/IN, a/DT, few/JJ, rare/JJ, exceptions/NNS, ,/,, men/NNS, wear/VBP, no/DT, masks/NNS, in/IN, Paris/NNP, ;/:, a/DT, man/NN, in/IN, a/DT, domino/NN, is/VBZ, thought/VBN, ridiculous/JJ, ./.]

In this the spirit of the nation betrays itself .
[In/IN, this/DT, the/DT, spirit/NN, of/IN, the/DT, nation/NN, betrays/VBZ, itself/PRP, ./.]

Men who want to hide their good fortune can enjoy the opera ball without going there ; and masks who are absolutely compelled to go in come out again at once .
[Men/NNS, who/WP, want/VBP, to/TO, hide/VB, their/PRP$, good/JJ, fortune/NN, can/MD, enjoy/VB, the/DT, opera/NN, ball/NN, without/IN, going/VBG, there/RB, ;/:, and/CC, masks/NNS, who/WP, are/VBP, absolutely/RB, compelled/VBN, to/TO, go/VB, in/RP, come/VBP, out/RP, again/RB, at/IN, once/RB, ./.]

One of the most amusing scenes is the crush at the doors produced as soon as the dancing begins , by the rush of persons getting away and struggling with those who are pushing in .
[One/CD, of/IN, the/DT, most/RBS, amusing/JJ, scenes/NNS, is/VBZ, the/DT, crush/NN, at/IN, the/DT, doors/NNS, produced/VBN, as/RB, soon/RB, as/IN, the/DT, dancing/NN, begins/VBZ, ,/,, by/IN, the/DT, rush/NN, of/IN, persons/NNS, getting/VBG, away/RP, and/CC, struggling/VBG, with/IN, those/DT, who/WP, are/VBP, pushing/VBG, in/RP, ./.]

So the men who wear masks are either jealous husbands who come to watch their wives , or husbands on the loose who do not wish to be watched by them -- two situations equally ridiculous .
[So/IN, the/DT, men/NNS, who/WP, wear/VBP, masks/NNS, are/VBP, either/RB, jealous/JJ, husbands/NNS, who/WP, come/VBP, to/TO, watch/VB, their/PRP$, wives/NNS, ,/,, or/CC, husbands/NNS, on/IN, the/DT, loose/JJ, who/WP, do/VBP, not/RB, wish/VB, to/TO, be/VB, watched/VBN, by/IN, them/PRP, --/:, two/CD, situations/NNS, equally/RB, ridiculous/JJ, ./.]

Now , our young man was followed , though he knew it not , by a man in a mask , dogging his steps , short and stout , with a rolling gait , like a barrel .
[Now/RB, ,/,, our/PRP$, young/JJ, man/NN, was/VBD, followed/VBN, ,/,, though/IN, he/PRP, knew/VBD, it/PRP, not/RB, ,/,, by/IN, a/DT, man/NN, in/IN, a/DT, mask/NN, ,/,, dogging/VBG, his/PRP$, steps/NNS, ,/,, short/JJ, and/CC, stout/JJ, ,/,, with/IN, a/DT, rolling/VBG, gait/NN, ,/,, like/IN, a/DT, barrel/NN, ./.]

To every one familiar with the opera this disguise betrayed a stock-broker , a banker , a lawyer , some citizen soul suspicious of infidelity .
[To/TO, every/DT, one/NN, familiar/JJ, with/IN, the/DT, opera/NN, this/DT, disguise/NN, betrayed/VBZ, a/DT, stock-broker/NN, ,/,, a/DT, banker/NN, ,/,, a/DT, lawyer/NN, ,/,, some/DT, citizen/NN, soul/NN, suspicious/JJ, of/IN, infidelity/NN, ./.]

For in fact , in really high society , no one courts such humiliating proofs .
[For/IN, in/IN, fact/NN, ,/,, in/IN, really/RB, high/JJ, society/NN, ,/,, no/DT, one/CD, courts/NNS, such/JJ, humiliating/JJ, proofs/VBZ, ./.]

Several masks had laughed as they pointed this preposterous figure out to each other ; some had spoken to him , a few young men had made game of him , but his stolid manner showed entire contempt for these aimless shafts ; he went on whither the young man led him , as a hunted wild boar goes on and pays no heed to the bullets whistling about his ears , or the dogs barking at his heels .
[Several/XX, masks/XX, had/XX, laughed/XX, as/XX, they/XX, pointed/XX, this/XX, preposterous/XX, figure/XX, out/XX, to/XX, each/XX, other/XX, ;/XX, some/XX, had/XX, spoken/XX, to/XX, him/XX, ,/XX, a/XX, few/XX, young/XX, men/XX, had/XX, made/XX, game/XX, of/XX, him/XX, ,/XX, but/XX, his/XX, stolid/XX, manner/XX, showed/XX, entire/XX, contempt/XX, for/XX, these/XX, aimless/XX, shafts/XX, ;/XX, he/XX, went/XX, on/XX, whither/XX, the/XX, young/XX, man/XX, led/XX, him/XX, ,/XX, as/XX, a/XX, hunted/XX, wild/XX, boar/XX, goes/XX, on/XX, and/XX, pays/XX, no/XX, heed/XX, to/XX, the/XX, bullets/XX, whistling/XX, about/XX, his/XX, ears/XX, ,/XX, or/XX, the/XX, dogs/XX, barking/XX, at/XX, his/XX, heels/XX, ./XX]

Though at first sight pleasure and anxiety wear the same livery -- the noble black robe of Venice -- and though all is confusion at an opera ball , the various circles composing Parisian society meet there , recognize , and watch each other .
[Though/IN, at/IN, first/JJ, sight/NN, pleasure/NN, and/CC, anxiety/NN, wear/VBP, the/DT, same/JJ, livery/NN, --/:, the/DT, noble/JJ, black/JJ, robe/NN, of/IN, Venice/NNP, --/:, and/CC, though/IN, all/DT, is/VBZ, confusion/NN, at/IN, an/DT, opera/NN, ball/NN, ,/,, the/DT, various/JJ, circles/NNS, composing/VBG, Parisian/JJ, society/NN, meet/VB, there/RB, ,/,, recognize/VB, ,/,, and/CC, watch/VB, each/DT, other/JJ, ./.]

There are certain ideas so clear to the initiated that this scrawled medley of interests is as legible to them as any amusing novel .
[There/EX, are/VBP, certain/JJ, ideas/NNS, so/RB, clear/JJ, to/TO, the/DT, initiated/NN, that/IN, this/DT, scrawled/JJ, medley/NN, of/IN, interests/NNS, is/VBZ, as/RB, legible/JJ, to/TO, them/PRP, as/IN, any/DT, amusing/JJ, novel/NN, ./.]

So , to these old hands , this man could not be here by appointment ; he would infallibly have worn some token , red , white , or green , such as notifies a happy meeting previously agreed on .
[So/RB, ,/,, to/TO, these/DT, old/JJ, hands/NNS, ,/,, this/DT, man/NN, could/MD, not/RB, be/VB, here/RB, by/IN, appointment/NN, ;/:, he/PRP, would/MD, infallibly/RB, have/VB, worn/VBN, some/DT, token/JJ, ,/,, red/NN, ,/,, white/JJ, ,/,, or/CC, green/NN, ,/,, such/JJ, as/IN, notifies/NNS, a/DT, happy/JJ, meeting/NN, previously/RB, agreed/VBD, on/RP, ./.]

Was it a case of revenge ?
[Was/VBD, it/PRP, a/DT, case/NN, of/IN, revenge/NN, ?/.]

Seeing the domino following so closely in the wake of a man apparently happy in an assignation , some of the gazers looked again at the handsome face , on which anticipation had set its divine halo .
[Seeing/VBG, the/DT, domino/NN, following/VBG, so/RB, closely/RB, in/IN, the/DT, wake/NN, of/IN, a/DT, man/NN, apparently/RB, happy/JJ, in/IN, an/DT, assignation/NN, ,/,, some/DT, of/IN, the/DT, gazers/NNS, looked/VBD, again/RB, at/IN, the/DT, handsome/JJ, face/NN, ,/,, on/IN, which/WDT, anticipation/NN, had/VBD, set/VBN, its/PRP$, divine/JJ, halo/NN, ./.]

The youth was interesting ; the longer he wandered , the more curiosity he excited .
[The/DT, youth/NN, was/VBD, interesting/JJ, ;/:, the/DT, longer/JJR, he/PRP, wandered/VBD, ,/,, the/DT, more/RBR, curiosity/JJ, he/PRP, excited/VBN, ./.]

Everything about him proclaimed the habits of refined life .
[Everything/NN, about/IN, him/PRP, proclaimed/VBD, the/DT, habits/NNS, of/IN, refined/VBN, life/NN, ./.]

In obedience to a fatal law of the time we live in , there is not much difference , physical or moral , between the most elegant and best bred son of a duke and peer and this attractive youth , whom poverty had not long since held in its iron grip in the heart of Paris .
[In/IN, obedience/NN, to/TO, a/DT, fatal/JJ, law/NN, of/IN, the/DT, time/NN, we/PRP, live/VBP, in/RP, ,/,, there/EX, is/VBZ, not/RB, much/JJ, difference/NN, ,/,, physical/NN, or/CC, moral/JJ, ,/,, between/IN, the/DT, most/RBS, elegant/JJ, and/CC, best/JJS, bred/VBN, son/NN, of/IN, a/DT, duke/NN, and/CC, peer/NN, and/CC, this/DT, attractive/JJ, youth/NN, ,/,, whom/WP, poverty/NN, had/VBD, not/RB, long/RB, since/IN, held/VBN, in/IN, its/PRP$, iron/NN, grip/NN, in/IN, the/DT, heart/NN, of/IN, Paris/NNP, ./.]

Beauty and youth might cover him in deep gulfs , as in many a young man who longs to play a part in Paris without having the capital to support his pretensions , and who , day after day , risks all to win all , by sacrificing to the god who has most votaries in this royal city , namely , Chance .
[Beauty/NN, and/CC, youth/NN, might/MD, cover/VB, him/PRP, in/IN, deep/JJ, gulfs/NNS, ,/,, as/IN, in/IN, many/JJ, a/DT, young/JJ, man/NN, who/WP, longs/VBZ, to/TO, play/VB, a/DT, part/NN, in/IN, Paris/NNP, without/IN, having/VBG, the/DT, capital/NN, to/TO, support/VB, his/PRP$, pretensions/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, who/WP, ,/,, day/NN, after/IN, day/NN, ,/,, risks/VBZ, all/RB, to/TO, win/VB, all/DT, ,/,, by/IN, sacrificing/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, god/NN, who/WP, has/VBZ, most/RBS, votaries/JJ, in/IN, this/DT, royal/JJ, city/NN, ,/,, namely/RB, ,/,, Chance/NN, ./.]

At the same time , his dress and manners were above reproach ; he trod the classic floor of the opera house as one accustomed there .
[At/IN, the/DT, same/JJ, time/NN, ,/,, his/PRP$, dress/NN, and/CC, manners/NNS, were/VBD, above/IN, reproach/NN, ;/:, he/PRP, trod/VBD, the/DT, classic/JJ, floor/NN, of/IN, the/DT, opera/NN, house/NN, as/IN, one/CD, accustomed/VBN, there/RB, ./.]

Who can have failed to observe that there , as in every zone in Paris , there is a manner of being which shows who you are , what you are doing , whence you come , and what you want ?
[Who/WP, can/MD, have/VB, failed/VBN, to/TO, observe/VB, that/IN, there/EX, ,/,, as/IN, in/IN, every/DT, zone/NN, in/IN, Paris/NNP, ,/,, there/EX, is/VBZ, a/DT, manner/NN, of/IN, being/VBG, which/WDT, shows/VBZ, who/WP, you/PRP, are/VBP, ,/,, what/WP, you/PRP, are/VBP, doing/VBG, ,/,, whence/VBP, you/PRP, come/VBP, ,/,, and/CC, what/WP, you/PRP, want/VBP, ?/.]

`` What a handsome young fellow ; and here we may turn round to look at him , '' said a mask , in whom accustomed eyes recognized a lady of position .
[``/``, What/WP, a/DT, handsome/JJ, young/JJ, fellow/NN, ;/:, and/CC, here/RB, we/PRP, may/MD, turn/VB, round/VBP, to/TO, look/VB, at/IN, him/PRP, ,/,, ''/'', said/VBD, a/DT, mask/NN, ,/,, in/IN, whom/WP, accustomed/JJ, eyes/NNS, recognized/VBD, a/DT, lady/NN, of/IN, position/NN, ./.]

`` Do you not remember him ? ''
[``/``, Do/VB, you/PRP, not/RB, remember/VB, him/PRP, ?/., ''/'']

replied the man on whose arm she was leaning .
[replied/VBD, the/DT, man/NN, on/IN, whose/WP$, arm/NNS, she/PRP, was/VBD, leaning/VBG, ./.]

`` Madame du Chatelet introduced him to you -- '' `` What , is that the apothecary 's son she fancied herself in love with , who became a journalist , Mademoiselle Coralie 's lover ? ''

[``/``, The/DT, case/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Sieur/NNP, de/NNP, Rubempre/NNP, ,/,, whom/NNP, Rastignac/NNP, is/VBZ, setting/VBG, up/RP, as/IN, a/DT, person/NN, of/IN, consequence/NN, ,/,, ''/'', said/VBD, du/NNP, Chatelet/NNP, to/TO, the/DT, Secretary-General/NNP, ./.]

`` My dear Count , '' replied des Lupeaulx very seriously , `` Monsieur de Rubempre is a young man of the highest merit , and has such good interest at his back that I should be delighted to renew my acquaintance with him . ''

A little bedstead , of painted wood and old-fashioned shape , was hung with yellow cotton printed with red stars , one armchair and two small chairs , also of painted wood , and covered with the same cotton print of which the window-curtains were also made ; a gray wall-paper sprigged with flowers blackened and greasy with age ; a fireplace full of kitchen utensils of the vilest kind , two bundles of fire-logs ; a stone shelf , on which lay some jewelry false and real , a pair of scissors , a dirty pincushion , and some white scented gloves ; an exquisite hat perched on the water-jug , a Ternaux shawl stopping a hole in the window , a handsome gown hanging from a nail ; a little hard sofa , with no cushions ; broken clogs and dainty slippers , boots that a queen might have coveted ; cheap china plates , cracked or chipped , with fragments of a past meal , and nickel forks -- the plate of the Paris poor ; a basket full of potatoes and dirty linen , with a smart gauze cap on the top ; a rickety wardrobe , with a glass door , open and empty , and on the shelves sundry pawn-tickets , -- this was the medley of things , dismal or pleasing , abject and handsome , that fell on his eye .

These relics of splendor among the potsherds , these household belongings -- so appropriate to the bohemian existence of the girl who knelt stricken in her unbuttoned garments , like a horse dying in harness under the broken shafts entangled in the reins -- did the whole strange scene suggest any thoughts to the priest ?

Women who have lived the life that Esther had so violently repudiated come to feel absolute indifference as to the critics of our day , who may be compared with them in some respects , and who feel at last perfect disregard of the formulas of art ; they have read so many books , they see so many pass away , they are so much accustomed to written pages , they have gone through so many plots , they have seen so many dramas , they have written so many articles without saying what they meant , and have so often been treasonable to the cause of Art in favor of their personal likings and aversions , that they acquire a feeling of disgust of everything , and yet continue to pass judgment .

In a religious institution , famous for the aristocratic and pious teaching imparted there , one Monday morning in the beginning of March 1824 the pupils found their pretty flock increased by a newcomer , whose beauty triumphed without dispute not only over that of her companions , but over the special details of beauty which were found severally in perfection in each one of them .

When once this feeling has mounted to the brain of one of these great little men , after firing his heart and absorbing his senses , the poet becomes as far superior to humanity through love as he already is through the power of his imagination .
[When/WRB, once/RB, this/DT, feeling/NN, has/VBZ, mounted/VBN, to/TO, the/DT, brain/NN, of/IN, one/CD, of/IN, these/DT, great/JJ, little/JJ, men/NNS, ,/,, after/IN, firing/VBG, his/PRP$, heart/NN, and/CC, absorbing/VBG, his/PRP$, senses/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, poet/NN, becomes/VBZ, as/RB, far/RB, superior/JJ, to/TO, humanity/NN, through/IN, love/NN, as/IN, he/PRP, already/RB, is/VBZ, through/IN, the/DT, power/NN, of/IN, his/PRP$, imagination/NN, ./.]

A freak of intellectual heredity has given him the faculty of expressing nature by imagery , to which he gives the stamp both of sentiment and of thought , and he lends his love the wings of his spirit ; he feels , and he paints , he acts and meditates , he multiplies his sensations by thought , present felicity becomes threefold through aspiration for the future and memory of the past ; and with it he mingles the exquisite delights of the soul , which makes him the prince of artists .
[A/XX, freak/XX, of/XX, intellectual/XX, heredity/XX, has/XX, given/XX, him/XX, the/XX, faculty/XX, of/XX, expressing/XX, nature/XX, by/XX, imagery/XX, ,/XX, to/XX, which/XX, he/XX, gives/XX, the/XX, stamp/XX, both/XX, of/XX, sentiment/XX, and/XX, of/XX, thought/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, he/XX, lends/XX, his/XX, love/XX, the/XX, wings/XX, of/XX, his/XX, spirit/XX, ;/XX, he/XX, feels/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, he/XX, paints/XX, ,/XX, he/XX, acts/XX, and/XX, meditates/XX, ,/XX, he/XX, multiplies/XX, his/XX, sensations/XX, by/XX, thought/XX, ,/XX, present/XX, felicity/XX, becomes/XX, threefold/XX, through/XX, aspiration/XX, for/XX, the/XX, future/XX, and/XX, memory/XX, of/XX, the/XX, past/XX, ;/XX, and/XX, with/XX, it/XX, he/XX, mingles/XX, the/XX, exquisite/XX, delights/XX, of/XX, the/XX, soul/XX, ,/XX, which/XX, makes/XX, him/XX, the/XX, prince/XX, of/XX, artists/XX, ./XX]

Then the poet 's passion becomes a fine poem in which human proportion is often set at nought .

Such a love is the very essence of passion .
[Such/PDT, a/DT, love/NN, is/VBZ, the/DT, very/JJ, essence/NN, of/IN, passion/NN, ./.]

It is extreme in all things , in its hopes , in its despair , in its rage , in its melancholy , in its joy ; it flies , it leaps , it crawls ; it is not like any of the emotions known to ordinary men ; it is to everyday love what the perennial Alpine torrent is to the lowland brook .
[It/PRP, is/VBZ, extreme/JJ, in/IN, all/DT, things/NNS, ,/,, in/IN, its/PRP$, hopes/NNS, ,/,, in/IN, its/PRP$, despair/NN, ,/,, in/IN, its/PRP$, rage/NN, ,/,, in/IN, its/PRP$, melancholy/JJ, ,/,, in/IN, its/PRP$, joy/NN, ;/:, it/PRP, flies/VBZ, ,/,, it/PRP, leaps/VBZ, ,/,, it/PRP, crawls/VBZ, ;/:, it/PRP, is/VBZ, not/RB, like/IN, any/DT, of/IN, the/DT, emotions/NNS, known/VBN, to/TO, ordinary/JJ, men/NNS, ;/:, it/PRP, is/VBZ, to/TO, everyday/JJ, love/NN, what/WP, the/DT, perennial/JJ, Alpine/NNP, torrent/NN, is/VBZ, to/TO, the/DT, lowland/JJ, brook/NN, ./.]

These splendid geniuses are so rarely understood that they spend themselves in hopes deceived ; they are exhausted by the search for their ideal mistress , and almost always die like gorgeous insects splendidly adorned for their love-festival by the most poetical of nature 's inventions , and crushed under the foot of a passer-by .

You will often see in Paris such vehement promenaders , real gendarmes watching a recalcitrant National Guardsman , bailiffs taking steps to effect an arrest , creditors planning a trick on the debtor who has shut himself in , lovers , or jealous and suspicious husbands , or friends doing sentry for a friend ; but rarely do you meet a face portending such coarse and fierce thoughts as animated that of the gloomy and powerful man who paced to and fro under Mademoiselle Esther 's windows with the brooding haste of a bear in its cage .

In the midst of intoxicating happiness she never took unfair advantage of the unlimited power that the constantly revived desire of a lover gives to the woman he loves to ask Lucien a single question regarding Herrera , of whom indeed she lived in constant awe ; she dared not even think of him .

The simple candor of the old man , no longer the stock-jobber , who , for the first time in his life , saw that something was more sacred and more precious than gold , really moved these world-hardened men ; some exchanged smiles ; other looked at Nucingen with an expression that plainly said , `` Such a man to have come to this ! ''

Like all incurables , the Baron clutched at everything that seemed at all hopeful ; he promised himself that he would have Lucien watched by some one besides Louchard and his men -- Louchard , the sharpest commercial detective in Paris -- to whom he had applied about a fortnight since .

Before going home to Esther , Lucien was due at the Hotel Grandlieu , to spend the two hours which made Mademoiselle Clotilde Frederique de Grandlieu the happiest girl in the Faubourg Saint-Germain .

Carlos Herrera , a man at once ignoble and magnanimous , obscure and famous , compelled to live out of the world from which the law had banned him , exhausted by vice and by frenzied and terrible struggles , though endowed with powers of mind that ate into his soul , consumed especially by a fever of vitality , now lived again in the elegant person of Lucien de Rubempre , whose soul had become his own .

To him Lucien was more than a son , more than a woman beloved , more than a family , more than his life ; he was his revenge ; and as souls cling more closely to a feeling than to existence , he had bound the young man to him by insoluble ties .

After rescuing Lucien 's life at the moment when the poet in desperation was on the verge of suicide , he had proposed to him one of those infernal bargains which are heard of only in romances , but of which the hideous possibility has often been proved in courts of justice by celebrated criminal dramas .

The House of Grandlieu divided into two branches about the middle of the last century : first , the ducal line destined to lapse , since the present duke has only daughters ; and then the Vicomtes de Grandlieu , who will now inherit the title and armorial bearings of the elder branch .
[The/DT, House/NNP, of/IN, Grandlieu/NNP, divided/VBN, into/IN, two/CD, branches/NNS, about/IN, the/DT, middle/NN, of/IN, the/DT, last/JJ, century/NN, :/:, first/LS, ,/,, the/DT, ducal/JJ, line/NN, destined/VBN, to/TO, lapse/NN, ,/,, since/IN, the/DT, present/JJ, duke/NN, has/VBZ, only/JJ, daughters/NNS, ;/:, and/CC, then/RB, the/DT, Vicomtes/NNP, de/NNP, Grandlieu/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, will/MD, now/RB, inherit/VBP, the/DT, title/NN, and/CC, armorial/NN, bearings/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, elder/JJR, branch/NN, ./.]

The Duc and Duchesse de Grandlieu , on coming home in 1804 , were the object of the Emperor 's advances ; indeed , Napoleon , seeing them come to his court , restored to them all of the Grandlieu estates that had been confiscated to the nation , to the amount of about forty thousand francs a year .

The Vicomte de Grandlieu , the Duc de Rhetore , the Marquis de Chaulieu -- afterwards Duc de Lenoncourt-Chaulieu -- his wife , Madeleine de Mortsauf , the Duc de Lenoncourt 's grand-daughter , the Marquis d'Ajuda-Pinto , the Prince de Blamont-Chauvry , the Marquis de Beauseant , the Vidame de Pamiers , the Vandenesses , the old Prince de Cadignan , and his son the Duc de Maufrigneuse , were constantly to be seen in this stately drawing-room , where they breathed the atmosphere of a Court , where manners , tone , and wit were in harmony with the dignity of the Master and Mistress whose aristocratic mien and magnificence had obliterated the memory of their servility to Napoleon .

The Duc de Rhetore , the Chevalier d'Espard , and some others , jealous of Lucien , periodically stirred up the Duc de Grandlieu 's prejudices against him by retailing anecdotes of the young man 's previous career ; but the Duchess , a devout Catholic surrounded by the great prelates of the Church , and her daughter Clotilde would not give him up .
[The/DT, Duc/NNP, de/IN, Rhetore/NNP, ,/,, the/DT, Chevalier/NNP, d'Espard/NN, ,/,, and/CC, some/DT, others/NNS, ,/,, jealous/JJ, of/IN, Lucien/NNP, ,/,, periodically/RB, stirred/VBD, up/RP, the/DT, Duc/NNP, de/NNP, Grandlieu/NNP, 's/POS, prejudices/NNS, against/IN, him/PRP, by/IN, retailing/VBG, anecdotes/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, young/JJ, man/NN, 's/POS, previous/JJ, career/NN, ;/:, but/CC, the/DT, Duchess/NNPS, ,/,, a/DT, devout/JJ, Catholic/NNP, surrounded/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, great/JJ, prelates/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, Church/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, her/PRP$, daughter/NN, Clotilde/NN, would/MD, not/RB, give/VB, him/PRP, up/RP, ./.]

Then , feeling the importance of allying himself to so powerful a family , and urged by his privy adviser to win Clotilde , Lucien found the courage of the parvenu ; he came to the house five days in the week , he swallowed all the affronts of the envious , he endured impertinent looks , and answered irony with wit .
[Then/RB, ,/,, feeling/VBG, the/DT, importance/NN, of/IN, allying/VBG, himself/PRP, to/TO, so/RB, powerful/JJ, a/DT, family/NN, ,/,, and/CC, urged/VBN, by/IN, his/PRP$, privy/JJ, adviser/NN, to/TO, win/VB, Clotilde/NNP, ,/,, Lucien/NNP, found/VBD, the/DT, courage/NN, of/IN, the/DT, parvenu/NN, ;/:, he/PRP, came/VBD, to/TO, the/DT, house/NN, five/CD, days/NNS, in/IN, the/DT, week/NN, ,/,, he/PRP, swallowed/VBN, all/PDT, the/DT, affronts/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, envious/NNS, ,/,, he/PRP, endured/VBD, impertinent/NN, looks/VBZ, ,/,, and/CC, answered/VBD, irony/NN, with/IN, wit/NN, ./.]

`` You can not devote yourself to several houses at once , '' said his Mentor .

`` The man who goes everywhere finds no one to take a lively interest in him .
[``/``, The/DT, man/NN, who/WP, goes/VBZ, everywhere/RB, finds/VBZ, no/DT, one/NN, to/TO, take/VB, a/DT, lively/JJ, interest/NN, in/IN, him/PRP, ./.]

Insinuating , tactful , and warned by Clotilde of the shoals he should avoid , he flattered Monsieur de Grandlieu 's little weaknesses .

This cafe , like all cafes for that matter , had its eccentric character in the person of the said Pere Canquoelle , who had been regular in his attendance there since 1811 , and who seemed to be so completely in harmony with the good folks who assembled there , that they all talked politics in his presence without reserve .

If you looked no further than the most conspicuous feature of his face , a nose covered with excrescences red and swollen enough to figure in a dish of truffles , you might have inferred that the worthy man had an easy temper , foolish and easy-going , that of a perfect gaby ; and you would have been deceived , like all at the Cafe David , where no one had ever remarked the studious brow , the sardonic mouth , and the cold eyes of this old man , petted by his vices , and as calm as Vitellius , whose imperial and portly stomach reappeared in him palingenetically , so to speak .

In 1816 a young commercial traveler named Gaudissart , who frequented the Cafe David , sat drinking from eleven o'clock till midnight with a half-pay officer .

Peyrade felt the blow all the more keenly because , being greedy and a libertine , he had found himself , with regard to women , in the position of a pastry-cook who loves sweetmeats .

Louis XVIII .

`` Listen to me , Monsieur le Baron ; you must , in the first instance , place ten thousand francs in my hands , on account for expenses ; for , to you , this is a matter of life or death ; and as your life is a business-manufactory , nothing must be left undone to find this woman for you .

`` What a queer business ! ''

thought Peyrade , going back on foot to the Palais-Royal , where he intended trying to multiply his ten thousand francs by three , to make a little fortune for Lydie .
[thought/VBD, Peyrade/NNP, ,/,, going/VBG, back/RP, on/IN, foot/NN, to/TO, the/DT, Palais-Royal/NN, ,/,, where/WRB, he/PRP, intended/VBD, trying/VBG, to/TO, multiply/VB, his/PRP$, ten/CD, thousand/CD, francs/NNS, by/IN, three/CD, ,/,, to/TO, make/VB, a/DT, little/JJ, fortune/NN, for/IN, Lydie/NNP, ./.]

`` Here I am required to look into the private concerns of a very young man who has bewitched my little girl by a glance .
[``/``, Here/RB, I/PRP, am/VBP, required/VBN, to/TO, look/VB, into/IN, the/DT, private/JJ, concerns/NNS, of/IN, a/DT, very/RB, young/JJ, man/NN, who/WP, has/VBZ, bewitched/VBN, my/PRP$, little/JJ, girl/NN, by/IN, a/DT, glance/NN, ./.]

He is , I suppose , one of those men who have an eye for a woman , '' said he to himself , using an expression of a language of his own , in which his observations , or Corentin 's , were summed up in words that were anything rather than classical , but , for that very reason , energetic and picturesque .

[Have/VBP, not/RB, you/PRP, your/PRP$, cane/NN, ?/., ''/'']

Paccard , nicknamed The Old Guard , Old Wide-Awake , or The Right Man -- a man with legs of iron , arms of steel , Italian whiskers , hair like an artist 's , a beard like a sapper 's , and a face as colorless and immovable as Contenson 's , kept his spirit to himself , and rejoiced in a sort of drum-major appearance which disarmed suspicion .

Hitherto , novelists of manners have placed on the stage a great many usurers ; but the female money-lender has been overlooked , the Madame la Ressource of the present day -- a very singular figure , euphemistically spoken of as a `` ward-robe purchaser '' ; a part that the ferocious Asie could play , for she had two old-clothes shops managed by women she could trust -- one in the Temple , and the other in the Rue Neuve-Saint-Marc .

There is a dunghill of flowers , among which here and there we find a bright rose plucked but yesterday and worn for a day ; and on this an old hag is always to be seen crouching -- first cousin to Usury , the skinflint bargainer , bald and toothless , and ever ready to sell the contents , so well is she used to sell the covering -- the gown without the woman , or the woman without the gown !

Here Asie was in her element , like the warder among convicts , like a vulture red-beaked amid corpses ; more terrible than the savage horrors that made the passer-by shudder in astonishment sometimes , at seeing one of their youngest and sweetest reminiscences hung up in a dirty shop window , behind which a Saint-Esteve sits and grins .

From the group of bumbailiffs , looking like what they were , all standing with their horrible hats on their yet more horrible heads , with mahogany-colored faces and bleared eyes , damaged noses , and hideous mouths , Louchard now stepped forth , more decently dressed than his men , but keeping his hat on , his expression at once smooth-faced and smiling .

When , half an hour after , Europe went into her mistress ' room , she found her kneeling in front of a crucifix , in the attitude which the most religious of painters has given to Moses before the burning bush on Horeb , to depict his deep and complete adoration of Jehovah .

Esther 's coachman was Paccard -- for her household had been made up in five days by Asie , Europe , and Paccard under Carlos ' instructions , and in such a way that the house in the Rue Saint-Georges was an impregnable fortress .

Peyrade could dress so exactly like an Englishman , and spoke French so perfectly with the mincing accent that the English give the language ; he knew England itself so well , and was so familiar with all the customs of the country , having been sent to England by the police authorities three times between 1779 and 1786 , that he could play his part in London and at ambassadors ' residences without awaking suspicion .

This good soul , an honest and virtuous citizen , even pious , looked on the courtesan as a woman of a superior order ; she had always seen her in the midst of luxury , and thought of her as a fallen queen ; she trusted her daughters with her ; and -- which is a fact more natural than might be supposed -- the courtesan was as scrupulously careful in taking them to the play as their mother could have been , and the two Gerard girls loved her .

Next morning , between Orleans and Tours , Derville , being bored , began to converse , and Corentin condescended to amuse him , but keeping his distance ; he left him to believe that he was in the diplomatic service , and was hoping to become Consul-General by the good offices of the Duc de Grandlieu .

Two days after leaving Paris , Corentin and Derville got out at Mansle , to the great surprise of the lawyer , who thought he was going to Angouleme .

`` In this little town , '' said Corentin , `` we can get the most positive information as regards Madame Sechard . ''

`` I made the conductor talk , finding he was a native of Angouleme .

He tells me that Madame Sechard lives at Marsac , and Marsac is but a league away from Mansle .
[He/PRP, tells/VBZ, me/PRP, that/IN, Madame/NNP, Sechard/NNP, lives/VBZ, at/IN, Marsac/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, Marsac/NNP, is/VBZ, but/CC, a/DT, league/NN, away/RB, from/IN, Mansle/NNP, ./.]

I thought we should be at greater advantage here than at Angouleme for verifying the facts . ''
[I/PRP, thought/VBD, we/PRP, should/MD, be/VB, at/IN, greater/JJR, advantage/NN, here/RB, than/IN, at/IN, Angouleme/NNP, for/IN, verifying/VBG, the/DT, facts/NNS, ./., ''/'']

`` And besides , '' thought Derville , `` as Monsieur le Duc said , I act merely as the witness to the inquiries made by this confidential agent -- '' The inn at Mansle , _ la Belle Etoile _ , had for its landlord one of those fat and burly men whom we fear we may find no more on our return ; but who still , ten years after , are seen standing at their door with as much superfluous flesh as ever , in the same linen cap , the same apron , with the same knife , the same oiled hair , the same triple chin , -- all stereotyped by novel-writers from the immortal Cervantes to the immortal Walter Scott .

Contenson read by the light of the wax-candles this `` Mene , Tekel , Upharsin , '' and slipped the scrap into his pocket ; but he knew how difficult it is to verify a handwriting in pencil , and , above all , a sentence written in Roman capitals , that is to say , with mathematical lines , since capital letters are wholly made up of straight lines and curves , in which it is impossible to detect any trick of the hand , as in what is called running-hand .

THE END OF EVIL WAYS At six o'clock next morning two vehicles with postilions , prison vans , called in the vigorous language of the populace , _ paniers a salade _ , came out of La Force to drive to the Conciergerie by the Palais de Justice .
[THE/DT, END/NNP, OF/NNP, EVIL/NNP, WAYS/NNP, At/IN, six/CD, o'clock/RB, next/JJ, morning/NN, two/CD, vehicles/NNS, with/IN, postilions/NNS, ,/,, prison/NN, vans/NNS, ,/,, called/VBD, in/IN, the/DT, vigorous/JJ, language/NN, of/IN, the/DT, populace/NN, ,/,, _/RB, paniers/VBZ, a/DT, salade/JJ, _/NN, ,/,, came/VBD, out/RP, of/IN, La/NNP, Force/NNP, to/TO, drive/VB, to/TO, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, by/IN, the/DT, Palais/NNP, de/NNP, Justice/NNP, ./.]

Few loafers in Paris can have failed to meet this prison cell on wheels ; still , though most stories are written for Parisian readers , strangers will no doubt be satisfied to have a description of this formidable machine .
[Few/JJ, loafers/NNS, in/IN, Paris/NNP, can/MD, have/VB, failed/VBN, to/TO, meet/VB, this/DT, prison/NN, cell/NN, on/IN, wheels/NNS, ;/:, still/RB, ,/,, though/IN, most/JJS, stories/NNS, are/VBP, written/VBN, for/IN, Parisian/JJ, readers/NNS, ,/,, strangers/NNS, will/MD, no/DT, doubt/NN, be/VB, satisfied/JJ, to/TO, have/VB, a/DT, description/NN, of/IN, this/DT, formidable/JJ, machine/NN, ./.]

Who knows ?
[Who/WP, knows/VBZ, ?/.]

A police of Russia , Germany , or Austria , the legal body of countries to whom the `` Salad-basket '' is an unknown machine , may profit by it ; and in several foreign countries there can be no doubt that an imitation of this vehicle would be a boon to prisoners .
[A/DT, police/NN, of/IN, Russia/NNP, ,/,, Germany/NNP, ,/,, or/CC, Austria/NNP, ,/,, the/DT, legal/JJ, body/NN, of/IN, countries/NNS, to/TO, whom/WP, the/DT, ``/``, Salad-basket/NN, ''/'', is/VBZ, an/DT, unknown/JJ, machine/NN, ,/,, may/MD, profit/VB, by/IN, it/PRP, ;/:, and/CC, in/IN, several/JJ, foreign/JJ, countries/NNS, there/EX, can/MD, be/VB, no/DT, doubt/NN, that/IN, an/DT, imitation/NN, of/IN, this/DT, vehicle/NN, would/MD, be/VB, a/DT, boon/NN, to/TO, prisoners/NNS, ./.]

This ignominious conveyance , yellow-bodied , on high wheels , and lined with sheet-iron , is divided into two compartments .
[This/DT, ignominious/JJ, conveyance/NN, ,/,, yellow-bodied/VBN, ,/,, on/IN, high/JJ, wheels/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, lined/VBN, with/IN, sheet-iron/NN, ,/,, is/VBZ, divided/VBN, into/IN, two/CD, compartments/NNS, ./.]

In front is a box-seat , with leather cushions and an apron .
[In/IN, front/NN, is/VBZ, a/DT, box-seat/NN, ,/,, with/IN, leather/NN, cushions/NNS, and/CC, an/DT, apron/NN, ./.]

This is the free seat of the van , and accommodates a sheriff 's officer and a gendarme .
[This/DT, is/VBZ, the/DT, free/JJ, seat/NN, of/IN, the/DT, van/NN, ,/,, and/CC, accommodates/VBZ, a/DT, sheriff/NN, 's/POS, officer/NN, and/CC, a/DT, gendarme/NN, ./.]

A strong iron trellis , reaching to the top , separates this sort of cab-front from the back division , in which there are two wooden seats placed sideways , as in an omnibus , on which the prisoners sit .
[A/DT, strong/JJ, iron/NN, trellis/NNS, ,/,, reaching/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, top/NN, ,/,, separates/VBZ, this/DT, sort/NN, of/IN, cab-front/NN, from/IN, the/DT, back/JJ, division/NN, ,/,, in/IN, which/WDT, there/EX, are/VBP, two/CD, wooden/JJ, seats/NNS, placed/VBN, sideways/RB, ,/,, as/RB, in/IN, an/DT, omnibus/NN, ,/,, on/IN, which/WDT, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, sit/VBP, ./.]

They get in by a step behind and a door , with no window .
[They/PRP, get/VBP, in/IN, by/IN, a/DT, step/NN, behind/NN, and/CC, a/DT, door/NN, ,/,, with/IN, no/DT, window/NN, ./.]

The nickname of Salad-basket arose from the fact that the vehicle was originally made entirely of lattice , and the prisoners were shaken in it just as a salad is shaken to dry it .
[The/DT, nickname/NN, of/IN, Salad-basket/NNP, arose/VBD, from/IN, the/DT, fact/NN, that/IN, the/DT, vehicle/NN, was/VBD, originally/RB, made/VBN, entirely/RB, of/IN, lattice/NN, ,/,, and/CC, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, were/VBD, shaken/VBN, in/IN, it/PRP, just/RB, as/IN, a/DT, salad/NN, is/VBZ, shaken/VBN, to/TO, dry/VB, it/PRP, ./.]

For further security , in case of accident , a mounted gendarme follows the machine , especially when it conveys criminals condemned to death to the place of execution .
[For/IN, further/JJ, security/NN, ,/,, in/IN, case/NN, of/IN, accident/NN, ,/,, a/DT, mounted/JJ, gendarme/NN, follows/VBZ, the/DT, machine/NN, ,/,, especially/RB, when/WRB, it/PRP, conveys/VBZ, criminals/NNS, condemned/VBD, to/TO, death/NN, to/TO, the/DT, place/NN, of/IN, execution/NN, ./.]

Thus escape is impossible .
[Thus/RB, escape/NN, is/VBZ, impossible/JJ, ./.]

The vehicle , lined with sheet-iron , is impervious to any tool .
[The/DT, vehicle/NN, ,/,, lined/VBN, with/IN, sheet-iron/NN, ,/,, is/VBZ, impervious/JJ, to/TO, any/DT, tool/NN, ./.]

The prisoners , carefully searched when they are arrested or locked up , can have nothing but watch-springs , perhaps , to file through bars , and useless on a smooth surface .
[The/DT, prisoners/NNS, ,/,, carefully/RB, searched/VBD, when/WRB, they/PRP, are/VBP, arrested/VBN, or/CC, locked/VBN, up/RP, ,/,, can/MD, have/VB, nothing/NN, but/CC, watch-springs/VBZ, ,/,, perhaps/RB, ,/,, to/TO, file/VB, through/IN, bars/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, useless/JJ, on/IN, a/DT, smooth/JJ, surface/NN, ./.]

So the _ panier a salade _ , improved by the genius of the Paris police , became the model for the prison omnibus -LRB- known in London as `` Black Maria '' -RRB- in which convicts are transported to the hulks , instead of the horrible tumbril which formerly disgraced civilization , though Manon Lescaut had made it famous .

Nine-tenths of my readers , ay , and nine-tenths of the remaining tenth , are certainly ignorant of the vast difference of meaning in the words incriminated , suspected , accused , and committed for trial -- jail , house of detention , and penitentiary ; and they may be surprised to learn here that it involves all our criminal procedure , of which a clear and brief outline will presently be sketched , as much for their information as for the elucidation of this history .

The great days of July 1830 , and the tremendous storm that then burst , have so completely wiped out the memory of all previous events , and politics so entirely absorbed the French during the last six months of that year , that no one remembers -- or a few scarcely remember -- the various private , judicial , and financial catastrophes , strange as they were , which , forming the annual flood of Parisian curiosity , were not lacking during the first six months of the year .

A crime is committed ; if it is flagrant , the persons incriminated -LRB- inculpes -RRB- are taken to the nearest lock-up and placed in the cell known to the vulgar as the Violon -- perhaps because they make a noise there , shrieking or crying .

From thence the suspected persons -LRB- inculpes -RRB- are taken before the police commissioner or magistrate , who holds a preliminary inquiry , and can dismiss the case if there is any mistake ; finally , they are conveyed to the Depot of the Prefecture , where the police detains them pending the convenience of the public prosecutor and the examining judge .

They , being served with due notice , more or less quickly , according to the gravity of the case , come and examine the prisoners who are still provisionally detained .
[They/PRP, ,/,, being/VBG, served/VBN, with/IN, due/JJ, notice/NN, ,/,, more/RBR, or/CC, less/RBR, quickly/RB, ,/,, according/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, gravity/NN, of/IN, the/DT, case/NN, ,/,, come/VBP, and/CC, examine/VBP, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, who/WP, are/VBP, still/RB, provisionally/RB, detained/VBN, ./.]

[There/EX, are/VBP, three/CD, such/JJ, jails/NNS, -LRB-/-LRB-, Maisons/NNP, d'Arret/NN, -RRB-/-RRB-, in/IN, Paris/NNP, --/:, Sainte-Pelagie/NNP, ,/,, La/NNP, Force/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, les/NNP, Madelonettes/NNP, ./.]

Observe the word inculpe , incriminated , or suspected of crime .
[Observe/VB, the/DT, word/NN, inculpe/NN, ,/,, incriminated/VBN, ,/,, or/CC, suspected/VBN, of/IN, crime/NN, ./.]

The French Code has created three essential degrees of criminality -- inculpe , first degree of suspicion ; prevenu , under examination ; accuse , fully committed for trial .
[The/DT, French/NNP, Code/NNP, has/VBZ, created/VBN, three/CD, essential/JJ, degrees/NNS, of/IN, criminality/NN, --/:, inculpe/JJ, ,/,, first/JJ, degree/NN, of/IN, suspicion/NN, ;/:, prevenu/NN, ,/,, under/IN, examination/NN, ;/:, accuse/NNP, ,/,, fully/RB, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, ./.]

So long as the warrant for committal remains unsigned , the supposed criminal is regarded as merely under suspicion , inculpe of the crime or felony ; when the warrant has been issued , he becomes `` the accused '' -LRB- prevenu -RRB- , and is regarded as such so long as the inquiry is proceeding ; when the inquiry is closed , and as soon as the Court has decided that the accused is to be committed for trial , he becomes `` the prisoner at the bar '' -LRB- accuse -RRB- as soon as the superior court , at the instance of the public prosecutor , has pronounced that the charge is so far proved as to be carried to the Assizes .
[So/XX, long/XX, as/XX, the/XX, warrant/XX, for/XX, committal/XX, remains/XX, unsigned/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, supposed/XX, criminal/XX, is/XX, regarded/XX, as/XX, merely/XX, under/XX, suspicion/XX, ,/XX, inculpe/XX, of/XX, the/XX, crime/XX, or/XX, felony/XX, ;/XX, when/XX, the/XX, warrant/XX, has/XX, been/XX, issued/XX, ,/XX, he/XX, becomes/XX, ``/XX, the/XX, accused/XX, ''/XX, -LRB-/XX, prevenu/XX, -RRB-/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, is/XX, regarded/XX, as/XX, such/XX, so/XX, long/XX, as/XX, the/XX, inquiry/XX, is/XX, proceeding/XX, ;/XX, when/XX, the/XX, inquiry/XX, is/XX, closed/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, as/XX, soon/XX, as/XX, the/XX, Court/XX, has/XX, decided/XX, that/XX, the/XX, accused/XX, is/XX, to/XX, be/XX, committed/XX, for/XX, trial/XX, ,/XX, he/XX, becomes/XX, ``/XX, the/XX, prisoner/XX, at/XX, the/XX, bar/XX, ''/XX, -LRB-/XX, accuse/XX, -RRB-/XX, as/XX, soon/XX, as/XX, the/XX, superior/XX, court/XX, ,/XX, at/XX, the/XX, instance/XX, of/XX, the/XX, public/XX, prosecutor/XX, ,/XX, has/XX, pronounced/XX, that/XX, the/XX, charge/XX, is/XX, so/XX, far/XX, proved/XX, as/XX, to/XX, be/XX, carried/XX, to/XX, the/XX, Assizes/XX, ./XX]

Thus , persons suspected of crime go through three different stages , three siftings , before coming up for trial before the judges of the upper Court -- the High Justice of the realm .
[Thus/RB, ,/,, persons/NNS, suspected/VBN, of/IN, crime/NN, go/VBP, through/IN, three/CD, different/JJ, stages/NNS, ,/,, three/CD, siftings/NNS, ,/,, before/IN, coming/VBG, up/RP, for/IN, trial/NN, before/IN, the/DT, judges/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, upper/JJ, Court/NN, --/:, the/DT, High/NNP, Justice/NNP, of/IN, the/DT, realm/NN, ./.]

At the first stage , innocent persons have abundant means of exculpating themselves -- the public , the town watch , the police .
[At/IN, the/DT, first/JJ, stage/NN, ,/,, innocent/JJ, persons/NNS, have/VBP, abundant/JJ, means/NNS, of/IN, exculpating/VBG, themselves/PRP, --/:, the/DT, public/NN, ,/,, the/DT, town/NN, watch/NN, ,/,, the/DT, police/NN, ./.]

At the second state they appear before a magistrate face to face with the witnesses , and are judged by a tribunal in Paris , or by the Collective Court of the departments .
[At/IN, the/DT, second/JJ, state/NN, they/PRP, appear/VBP, before/IN, a/DT, magistrate/NN, face/VBP, to/TO, face/VB, with/IN, the/DT, witnesses/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, are/VBP, judged/VBN, by/IN, a/DT, tribunal/NN, in/IN, Paris/NNP, ,/,, or/CC, by/IN, the/DT, Collective/NNP, Court/NNP, of/IN, the/DT, departments/NNS, ./.]

At the third stage they are brought before a bench of twelve councillors , and in case of any error or informality the prisoner committed for trial at the Assizes may appeal for protection to the Supreme court .
[At/IN, the/DT, third/JJ, stage/NN, they/PRP, are/VBP, brought/VBN, before/IN, a/DT, bench/NN, of/IN, twelve/CD, councillors/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, in/IN, case/NN, of/IN, any/DT, error/NN, or/CC, informality/NN, the/DT, prisoner/NN, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, at/IN, the/DT, Assizes/NNPS, may/MD, appeal/VB, for/IN, protection/NN, to/TO, the/DT, Supreme/NNP, court/NN, ./.]

The jury do not know what a slap in the face they give to popular authority , to administrative and judicial functionaries , when they acquit a prisoner .
[The/DT, jury/NN, do/VBP, not/RB, know/VB, what/WP, a/DT, slap/NN, in/IN, the/DT, face/NN, they/PRP, give/VBP, to/TO, popular/JJ, authority/NN, ,/,, to/TO, administrative/JJ, and/CC, judicial/JJ, functionaries/NNS, ,/,, when/WRB, they/PRP, acquit/VB, a/DT, prisoner/NN, ./.]

The detenu is the convict .
[The/DT, detenu/NN, is/VBZ, the/DT, convict/NN, ./.]

French criminal law recognizes imprisonment of three degrees , corresponding in legal distinction to these three degrees of suspicion , inquiry , and conviction .
[French/JJ, criminal/JJ, law/NN, recognizes/VBZ, imprisonment/NN, of/IN, three/CD, degrees/NNS, ,/,, corresponding/JJ, in/IN, legal/JJ, distinction/NN, to/TO, these/DT, three/CD, degrees/NNS, of/IN, suspicion/NN, ,/,, inquiry/NN, ,/,, and/CC, conviction/NN, ./.]

Mere imprisonment is a light penalty for misdemeanor , but detention is imprisonment with hard labor , a severe and sometimes degrading punishment .
[Mere/JJ, imprisonment/NN, is/VBZ, a/DT, light/JJ, penalty/NN, for/IN, misdemeanor/NN, ,/,, but/CC, detention/NN, is/VBZ, imprisonment/NN, with/IN, hard/JJ, labor/NN, ,/,, a/DT, severe/JJ, and/CC, sometimes/RB, degrading/JJ, punishment/NN, ./.]

The gendarmes who apprehend him , the commissioner who questions him , those who take him to prison , the warders who lead him to his cell -- which is actually called a cachot , a dungeon or hiding-place , those again who take him by the arms to put him into a prison-van -- every being that comes near him from the moment of his arrest is either speechless , or takes note of all he says , to be repeated to the police or to the judge .

As has been told , Asie , that skilled Locusta , had given him a dose of poison so qualified as to produce the effects of a dreadful illness .

`` He has taken poison ! ''
[``/``, He/PRP, has/VBZ, taken/VBN, poison/NN, !/., ''/'']

`` That was the best thing he could do if he should be guilty , '' replied the public prosecutor .

the police commissioner asked .
[the/DT, police/NN, commissioner/NN, asked/VBD, ./.]

The police is always incredulous .
[The/DT, police/NN, is/VBZ, always/RB, incredulous/JJ, ./.]

The three lawyers had spoken , as may be imagined , in a whisper ; but Jacques Collin had guessed from their faces the subject under discussion , and had taken advantage of it to make the first brief examination which is gone through on arrest absolutely impossible and useless ; he had stammered out sentences in which Spanish and French were so mingled as to make nonsense .

At La Force this farce had been all the more successful in the first instance because the head of the `` safety '' force -- an abbreviation of the title `` Head of the brigade of the guardians of public safety '' -- Bibi-Lupin , who had long since taken Jacques Collin into custody at Madame Vauquer 's boarding-house , had been sent on special business into the country , and his deputy was a man who hoped to succeed him , but to whom the convict was unknown .

About half-way along the quay at a gloomy archway we see the beginning of the private houses which were built in consequence of the construction of the Pont Neuf in the reign of Henry IV .

for the Conciergerie has invaded the home of kings .

Municipal Council -LRB- to you I speak -RRB- , if you bestow millions , get a poet or two to assist your architects if you wish to save the cradle of Paris , the cradle of kings , while endeavoring to endow Paris and the Supreme Court with a palace worthy of France .

This epigram is intelligible .
[This/DT, epigram/NN, is/VBZ, intelligible/JJ, ./.]

In the early days of the monarchy , noble criminals -- for the villeins -LRB- a word signifying the peasantry in French and English alike -RRB- and the citizens came under the jurisdiction of the municipality or of their liege lord -- the lords of the greater or the lesser fiefs , were brought before the king and guarded in the Conciergerie .

To the left is the `` mousetrap , '' to the right the prison gates .
[To/TO, the/DT, left/NN, is/VBZ, the/DT, ``/``, mousetrap/NN, ,/,, ''/'', to/TO, the/DT, right/NN, the/DT, prison/NN, gates/NNS, ./.]

The `` salad-baskets '' can drive into this irregularly shaped courtyard , can stand there and turn with ease , and in case of a riot find some protection behind the strong grating of the gate under the arch ; whereas they formerly had no room to move in the narrow space dividing the outside steps from the right wing of the palace .
[The/DT, ``/``, salad-baskets/NNS, ''/'', can/MD, drive/VB, into/IN, this/DT, irregularly/RB, shaped/JJ, courtyard/NN, ,/,, can/MD, stand/VB, there/RB, and/CC, turn/VB, with/IN, ease/NN, ,/,, and/CC, in/IN, case/NN, of/IN, a/DT, riot/NN, find/VBP, some/DT, protection/NN, behind/IN, the/DT, strong/JJ, grating/NN, of/IN, the/DT, gate/NN, under/IN, the/DT, arch/NN, ;/:, whereas/IN, they/PRP, formerly/RB, had/VBD, no/DT, room/NN, to/TO, move/VB, in/IN, the/DT, narrow/JJ, space/NN, dividing/VBG, the/DT, outside/JJ, steps/NNS, from/IN, the/DT, right/JJ, wing/NN, of/IN, the/DT, palace/NN, ./.]

In our day the Conciergerie , hardly large enough for the prisoners committed for trial -- room being needed for about three hundred , men and women -- no longer receives either suspected or remanded criminals excepting in rare cases , as , for instance , in these of Jacques Collin and Lucien .
[In/IN, our/PRP$, day/NN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NN, ,/,, hardly/RB, large/JJ, enough/NN, for/IN, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, --/:, room/NN, being/VBG, needed/VBN, for/IN, about/RB, three/CD, hundred/CD, ,/,, men/NNS, and/CC, women/NNS, --/:, no/RB, longer/RB, receives/VBZ, either/CC, suspected/VBD, or/CC, remanded/VBD, criminals/NNS, excepting/VBG, in/IN, rare/JJ, cases/NNS, ,/,, as/IN, ,/,, for/IN, instance/NN, ,/,, in/IN, these/DT, of/IN, Jacques/NNP, Collin/NNP, and/CC, Lucien/NNP, ./.]

All who are imprisoned there are committed for trial before the Bench .
[All/DT, who/WP, are/VBP, imprisoned/VBN, there/RB, are/VBP, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, before/IN, the/DT, Bench/NNP, ./.]

As an exception criminals of the higher ranks are allowed to sojourn there , since , being already disgraced by a sentence in open court , their punishment would be too severe if they served their term of imprisonment at Melun or at Poissy .
[As/IN, an/DT, exception/NN, criminals/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, higher/JJR, ranks/NNS, are/VBP, allowed/VBN, to/TO, sojourn/VB, there/RB, ,/,, since/IN, ,/,, being/VBG, already/RB, disgraced/VBN, by/IN, a/DT, sentence/NN, in/IN, open/JJ, court/NN, ,/,, their/PRP$, punishment/NN, would/MD, be/VB, too/RB, severe/JJ, if/IN, they/PRP, served/VBD, their/PRP$, term/NN, of/IN, imprisonment/NN, at/IN, Melun/NNP, or/CC, at/IN, Poissy/NNP, ./.]

Ouvrard preferred to be imprisoned at the Conciergerie rather than at Sainte-Pelagie .
[Ouvrard/NNP, preferred/VBD, to/TO, be/VB, imprisoned/VBN, at/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, rather/RB, than/IN, at/IN, Sainte-Pelagie/NNP, ./.]

At this moment of writing Lehon the notary and the Prince de Bergues are serving their time there by an exercise of leniency which , though arbitrary , is humane .
[At/IN, this/DT, moment/NN, of/IN, writing/VBG, Lehon/NNP, the/DT, notary/NN, and/CC, the/DT, Prince/NNP, de/IN, Bergues/NNP, are/VBP, serving/VBG, their/PRP$, time/NN, there/RB, by/IN, an/DT, exercise/NN, of/IN, leniency/NN, which/WDT, ,/,, though/IN, arbitrary/JJ, ,/,, is/VBZ, humane/JJ, ./.]

As a rule , suspected criminals , whether they are to be subjected to a preliminary examination -- to `` go up , '' in the slang of the Courts -- or to appear before the magistrate of the lower Court , are transferred in prison vans direct to the `` mousetraps . ''
[As/IN, a/DT, rule/NN, ,/,, suspected/VBN, criminals/NNS, ,/,, whether/IN, they/PRP, are/VBP, to/TO, be/VB, subjected/VBN, to/TO, a/DT, preliminary/JJ, examination/NN, --/:, to/TO, ``/``, go/VB, up/RP, ,/,, ''/'', in/IN, the/DT, slang/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Courts/NNS, --/:, or/CC, to/TO, appear/VB, before/IN, the/DT, magistrate/NN, of/IN, the/DT, lower/JJR, Court/NNP, ,/,, are/VBP, transferred/VBN, in/IN, prison/NN, vans/NNS, direct/JJ, to/TO, the/DT, ``/``, mousetraps/NNS, ./., ''/'']

The `` mousetraps , '' opposite the gate , consist of a certain number of old cells constructed in the old kitchens of Saint-Louis ' building , whither prisoners not yet fully committed are brought to await the hour when the Court sits , or the arrival of the examining judge .
[The/DT, ``/``, mousetraps/NN, ,/,, ''/'', opposite/NN, the/DT, gate/NN, ,/,, consist/VBP, of/IN, a/DT, certain/JJ, number/NN, of/IN, old/JJ, cells/NNS, constructed/VBN, in/IN, the/DT, old/JJ, kitchens/NNS, of/IN, Saint-Louis/NNP, '/POS, building/NN, ,/,, whither/NN, prisoners/NNS, not/RB, yet/RB, fully/RB, committed/VBN, are/VBP, brought/VBN, to/TO, await/VB, the/DT, hour/NN, when/WRB, the/DT, Court/NNP, sits/VBZ, ,/,, or/CC, the/DT, arrival/NN, of/IN, the/DT, examining/JJ, judge/NN, ./.]

The `` mousetraps '' end on the north at the quay , on the east at the headquarters of the Municipal Guard , on the west at the courtyard of the Conciergerie , and on the south they adjoin a large vaulted hall , formerly , no doubt , the banqueting-room , but at present disused .
[The/DT, ``/``, mousetraps/NNS, ''/'', end/NN, on/IN, the/DT, north/NN, at/IN, the/DT, quay/NN, ,/,, on/IN, the/DT, east/JJ, at/IN, the/DT, headquarters/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Municipal/NNP, Guard/NNP, ,/,, on/IN, the/DT, west/NN, at/IN, the/DT, courtyard/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, on/IN, the/DT, south/NN, they/PRP, adjoin/NN, a/DT, large/JJ, vaulted/JJ, hall/NN, ,/,, formerly/RB, ,/,, no/DT, doubt/NN, ,/,, the/DT, banqueting-room/NN, ,/,, but/CC, at/IN, present/JJ, disused/NN, ./.]

Above the `` mousetraps '' is an inner guardroom with a window commanding the court of the Conciergerie ; this is used by the gendarmerie of the department , and the stairs lead up to it .
[Above/IN, the/DT, ``/``, mousetraps/NNS, ''/'', is/VBZ, an/DT, inner/JJ, guardroom/NN, with/IN, a/DT, window/NN, commanding/VBG, the/DT, court/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, ;/:, this/DT, is/VBZ, used/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, gendarmerie/NN, of/IN, the/DT, department/NN, ,/,, and/CC, the/DT, stairs/NNS, lead/VBP, up/RP, to/TO, it/PRP, ./.]

When the hour of trial strikes the sheriffs call the roll of the prisoners , the gendarmes go down , one for each prisoner , and each gendarme takes a criminal by the arm ; and thus , in couples , they mount the stairs , cross the guardroom , and are led along the passages to a room contiguous to the hall where sits the famous sixth chamber of the law -LRB- whose functions are those of an English county court -RRB- .

[The/DT, same/JJ, road/NN, is/VBZ, trodden/JJ, by/IN, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, on/IN, their/PRP$, way/NN, to/TO, and/CC, from/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NN, and/CC, the/DT, Assize/NNP, Court/NNP, ./.]

In the _ Salle des Pas-Perdus _ , between the door into the first court of the inferior class and the steps leading to the sixth , the visitor must observe the first time he goes there a doorway without a door or any architectural adornment , a square hole of the meanest type .
[In/IN, the/DT, _/NNP, Salle/NNP, des/FW, Pas-Perdus/NNP, _/NNP, ,/,, between/IN, the/DT, door/NN, into/IN, the/DT, first/JJ, court/NN, of/IN, the/DT, inferior/JJ, class/NN, and/CC, the/DT, steps/NNS, leading/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, sixth/NN, ,/,, the/DT, visitor/NN, must/MD, observe/VB, the/DT, first/JJ, time/NN, he/PRP, goes/VBZ, there/RB, a/DT, doorway/NN, without/IN, a/DT, door/NN, or/CC, any/DT, architectural/JJ, adornment/NN, ,/,, a/DT, square/JJ, hole/NN, of/IN, the/DT, meanest/JJ, type/NN, ./.]

Through this the judges and barristers find their way into the passages , into the guardhouse , down into the prison cells , and to the entrance to the Conciergerie .
[Through/IN, this/DT, the/DT, judges/NNS, and/CC, barristers/NNS, find/VBP, their/PRP$, way/NN, into/IN, the/DT, passages/NNS, ,/,, into/IN, the/DT, guardhouse/NN, ,/,, down/RB, into/IN, the/DT, prison/NN, cells/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, to/TO, the/DT, entrance/NN, to/TO, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, ./.]

[The/DT, private/JJ, chambers/NNS, of/IN, all/PDT, the/DT, examining/JJ, judges/NNS, are/VBP, on/IN, different/JJ, floors/NNS, in/IN, this/DT, part/NN, of/IN, the/DT, building/NN, ./.]

The windows of some look out on the quay , others on the yard of the Conciergerie .

In 1830 a few of these rooms commanded the Rue de la Barillerie .
[In/IN, 1830/CD, a/DT, few/JJ, of/IN, these/DT, rooms/NNS, commanded/VBD, the/DT, Rue/NNP, de/NNP, la/NNP, Barillerie/NNP, ./.]

Thus , when a prison van turns to the left in this yard , it has brought prisoners to be examined to the `` mousetrap '' ; when it turns to the right , it conveys prisoners committed for trial , to the Conciergerie .

Nothing can be more sinister .
[Nothing/NN, can/MD, be/VB, more/RBR, sinister/JJ, ./.]

Prisoners and visitors see two barred gates of wrought iron , with a space between them of about six feet .
[Prisoners/NNS, and/CC, visitors/NNS, see/VBP, two/CD, barred/VBD, gates/NNS, of/IN, wrought/JJ, iron/NN, ,/,, with/IN, a/DT, space/NN, between/IN, them/PRP, of/IN, about/RB, six/CD, feet/NNS, ./.]

These are never both opened at once , and through them everything is so cautiously scrutinized that persons who have a visiting ticket pass the permit through the bars before the key grinds in the lock .
[These/DT, are/VBP, never/RB, both/DT, opened/VBN, at/IN, once/RB, ,/,, and/CC, through/IN, them/PRP, everything/NN, is/VBZ, so/RB, cautiously/RB, scrutinized/VBN, that/IN, persons/NNS, who/WP, have/VBP, a/DT, visiting/VBG, ticket/NN, pass/VBP, the/DT, permit/NN, through/IN, the/DT, bars/NNS, before/IN, the/DT, key/NN, grinds/VBZ, in/IN, the/DT, lock/NN, ./.]

Imagine , then , the chances of communications or escape !

-- The governor of the Conciergerie would smile with an expression on his lips that would freeze the mere suggestion in the most daring of romancers who defy probability .

This hall abuts on the Tour de Montgomery -- which is now part of the governor 's residence -- and on the Tour d'Argent , serving as a dormitory for the warders , or porters , or turnkeys , as you may prefer to call them .
[This/DT, hall/NN, abuts/VBZ, on/IN, the/DT, Tour/NNP, de/NNP, Montgomery/NNP, --/:, which/WDT, is/VBZ, now/RB, part/NN, of/IN, the/DT, governor/NN, 's/POS, residence/NN, --/:, and/CC, on/IN, the/DT, Tour/NNP, d'Argent/NN, ,/,, serving/VBG, as/IN, a/DT, dormitory/NN, for/IN, the/DT, warders/NNS, ,/,, or/CC, porters/VBZ, ,/,, or/CC, turnkeys/VBZ, ,/,, as/IN, you/PRP, may/MD, prefer/VB, to/TO, call/VB, them/PRP, ./.]

The number of the officials is less than might be supposed ; there are but twenty ; their sleeping quarters , like their beds , are in no respect different from those of the _ pistoles _ or private cells .
[The/DT, number/NN, of/IN, the/DT, officials/NNS, is/VBZ, less/JJR, than/IN, might/MD, be/VB, supposed/VBN, ;/:, there/EX, are/VBP, but/CC, twenty/VBZ, ;/:, their/PRP$, sleeping/VBG, quarters/NNS, ,/,, like/IN, their/PRP$, beds/NNS, ,/,, are/VBP, in/IN, no/DT, respect/NN, different/JJ, from/IN, those/DT, of/IN, the/DT, _/JJ, pistoles/NNS, _/NN, or/CC, private/JJ, cells/NNS, ./.]

The name _ pistole _ originated , no doubt , in the fact that the prisoners formerly paid a pistole -LRB- about ten francs -RRB- a week for this accommodation , its bareness resembling that of the empty garrets in which great men in poverty begin their career in Paris .
[The/DT, name/NN, _/CD, pistole/NN, _/NN, originated/VBP, ,/,, no/DT, doubt/NN, ,/,, in/IN, the/DT, fact/NN, that/IN, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, formerly/RB, paid/VBD, a/DT, pistole/NN, -LRB-/-LRB-, about/RB, ten/CD, francs/NNS, -RRB-/-RRB-, a/DT, week/NN, for/IN, this/DT, accommodation/NN, ,/,, its/PRP$, bareness/NNS, resembling/VBG, that/DT, of/IN, the/DT, empty/JJ, garrets/NNS, in/IN, which/WDT, great/JJ, men/NNS, in/IN, poverty/NN, begin/VBP, their/PRP$, career/NN, in/IN, Paris/NNP, ./.]

[To/TO, the/DT, left/NN, ,/,, in/IN, the/DT, vast/JJ, entrance/NN, hall/NN, ,/,, sits/VBZ, the/DT, Governor/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, ,/,, in/IN, a/DT, sort/NN, of/IN, office/NN, constructed/VBN, of/IN, glass/NN, panes/NNS, ,/,, where/WRB, he/PRP, and/CC, his/PRP$, clerk/NN, keep/VB, the/DT, prison-registers/NNS, ./.]

[Here/RB, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, for/IN, examination/NN, ,/,, or/CC, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, ,/,, have/VBP, their/PRP$, names/NNS, entered/VBN, with/IN, a/DT, full/JJ, description/NN, ,/,, and/CC, are/VBP, then/RB, searched/JJ, ./.]

[The/DT, question/NN, of/IN, their/PRP$, lodging/NN, is/VBZ, also/RB, settled/VBN, ,/,, this/DT, depending/VBG, on/IN, the/DT, prisoner/NN, 's/POS, means/NNS, ./.]

Opposite the entrance to this hall there is a glass door .
[Opposite/VB, the/DT, entrance/NN, to/TO, this/DT, hall/NN, there/EX, is/VBZ, a/DT, glass/NN, door/NN, ./.]

This opens into a parlor where the prisoner 's relations and his counsel may speak with him across a double grating of wood .
[This/DT, opens/VBZ, into/IN, a/DT, parlor/NN, where/WRB, the/DT, prisoner/NN, 's/POS, relations/NNS, and/CC, his/PRP$, counsel/NN, may/MD, speak/VB, with/IN, him/PRP, across/IN, a/DT, double/JJ, grating/NN, of/IN, wood/NN, ./.]

[The/DT, parlor/NN, window/NN, opens/VBZ, on/RP, to/TO, the/DT, prison/NN, yard/NN, ,/,, the/DT, inner/JJ, court/NN, where/WRB, prisoners/NNS, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, take/VBP, air/NN, and/CC, exercise/NN, at/IN, certain/JJ, fixed/VBN, hours/NNS, ./.]

This large hall , only lighted by the doubtful daylight that comes in through the gates -- for the single window to the front court is screened by the glass office built out in front of it -- has an atmosphere and a gloom that strike the eye in perfect harmony with the pictures that force themselves on the imagination .
[This/DT, large/JJ, hall/NN, ,/,, only/RB, lighted/JJ, by/IN, the/DT, doubtful/JJ, daylight/NN, that/WDT, comes/VBZ, in/IN, through/IN, the/DT, gates/NNS, --/:, for/IN, the/DT, single/JJ, window/NN, to/TO, the/DT, front/JJ, court/NN, is/VBZ, screened/JJ, by/IN, the/DT, glass/NN, office/NN, built/VBN, out/RP, in/IN, front/NN, of/IN, it/PRP, --/:, has/VBZ, an/DT, atmosphere/NN, and/CC, a/DT, gloom/NN, that/WDT, strike/VBP, the/DT, eye/NN, in/IN, perfect/JJ, harmony/NN, with/IN, the/DT, pictures/NNS, that/WDT, force/VBP, themselves/PRP, on/IN, the/DT, imagination/NN, ./.]

Its aspect is all the more sinister because , parallel with the Tours d'Argent and de Montgomery , you discover those mysterious vaulted and overwhelming crypts which lead to the cells occupied by the Queen and Madame Elizabeth , and to those known as the secret cells .
[Its/PRP$, aspect/NN, is/VBZ, all/PDT, the/DT, more/RBR, sinister/JJ, because/IN, ,/,, parallel/VB, with/IN, the/DT, Tours/NNP, d'Argent/NN, and/CC, de/NNP, Montgomery/NNP, ,/,, you/PRP, discover/VBP, those/DT, mysterious/JJ, vaulted/NN, and/CC, overwhelming/JJ, crypts/NNS, which/WDT, lead/VBP, to/TO, the/DT, cells/NNS, occupied/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, Queen/NNP, and/CC, Madame/NNP, Elizabeth/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, to/TO, those/DT, known/VBN, as/IN, the/DT, secret/JJ, cells/NNS, ./.]

This maze of masonry , after being of old the scene of royal festivities , is now the basement of the Palais de Justice .

Between 1825 and 1832 the operation of the last toilet was performed in this enormous hall , between a large stove which heats it and the inner gate .

Ideas as to the treatment of criminals have not yet become disentangled from the old pictures of torture chambers , of the unhealthiness of a prison , the chill of stone walls sweating tears , the coarseness of the jailers and of the food -- inevitable accessories of the drama ; but it is not unnecessary to explain here that these exaggerations exist only on the stage , and only make lawyers and judges smile , as well as those who visit prisons out of curiosity , or who come to study them .

And it must be admitted that an innocent man is quickly released , especially in Paris .

So Lucien , on entering his cell , saw an exact reproduction of the first room he had occupied in Paris at the Hotel Cluny .
[So/IN, Lucien/NNP, ,/,, on/IN, entering/VBG, his/PRP$, cell/NN, ,/,, saw/VBD, an/DT, exact/JJ, reproduction/NN, of/IN, the/DT, first/JJ, room/NN, he/PRP, had/VBD, occupied/VBD, in/IN, Paris/NNP, at/IN, the/DT, Hotel/NNP, Cluny/NNP, ./.]

A bed to compare with those in the worst furnished apartments of the Quartier Latin , straw chairs with the bottoms out , a table and a few utensils , compose the furniture of such a room , in which two accused prisoners are not unfrequently placed together when they are quiet in their ways , and their misdeeds are not crimes of violence , but such as forgery or bankruptcy .

Such was the position , moral and physical , of these two prisoners , whose fate at the moment depended on Monsieur Camusot , examining judge to the Inferior Court of the Seine , and sovereign master , during the time granted to him by the Code , of the smallest details of their existence , since he alone could grant leave for them to be visited by the chaplains , the doctor , or any one else in the world .

[At/IN, the/DT, present/JJ, time/NN, ,/,, when/WRB, philosophers/NNS, ,/,, philanthropists/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, politicians/NNS, are/VBP, constantly/RB, endeavoring/VBG, to/TO, reduce/VB, every/DT, social/JJ, power/NN, ,/,, the/DT, rights/NNS, conferred/VBD, on/IN, the/DT, examining/JJ, judges/NNS, have/VBP, become/VBN, the/DT, object/NN, of/IN, attacks/NNS, that/WDT, are/VBP, all/PDT, the/DT, more/RBR, serious/JJ, because/IN, they/PRP, are/VBP, almost/RB, justified/JJ, by/IN, those/DT, rights/NNS, ,/,, which/WDT, ,/,, it/PRP, must/MD, be/VB, owned/VBN, ,/,, are/VBP, enormous/JJ, ./.]

And yet , as every man of sense will own , that power ought to remain unimpaired ; in certain cases , its exercise can be mitigated by a strong infusion of caution ; but society is already threatened by the ineptitude and weakness of the jury -- which is , in fact , the really supreme bench , and which ought to be composed only of choice and elected men -- and it would be in danger of ruin if this pillar were broken which now upholds our criminal procedure .

Arrest on suspicion is one of the terrible but necessary powers of which the risk to society is counterbalanced by its immense importance .
[Arrest/NN, on/IN, suspicion/NN, is/VBZ, one/CD, of/IN, the/DT, terrible/JJ, but/CC, necessary/JJ, powers/NNS, of/IN, which/WDT, the/DT, risk/NN, to/TO, society/NN, is/VBZ, counterbalanced/VBN, by/IN, its/PRP$, immense/JJ, importance/NN, ./.]

In these days a judge , paid as a functionary , and generally a poor man , has in the place of his dignity of old a haughtiness of demeanor that seems odious to the men raised to be his equals ; for haughtiness is dignity without a solid basis .
[In/IN, these/DT, days/NNS, a/DT, judge/NN, ,/,, paid/VBN, as/IN, a/DT, functionary/NN, ,/,, and/CC, generally/RB, a/DT, poor/JJ, man/NN, ,/,, has/VBZ, in/IN, the/DT, place/NN, of/IN, his/PRP$, dignity/NN, of/IN, old/JJ, a/DT, haughtiness/NNS, of/IN, demeanor/NN, that/WDT, seems/VBZ, odious/JJ, to/TO, the/DT, men/NNS, raised/VBN, to/TO, be/VB, his/PRP$, equals/NN, ;/:, for/IN, haughtiness/NNS, is/VBZ, dignity/NN, without/IN, a/DT, solid/JJ, basis/NN, ./.]

That is the vicious element in the present system .
[That/DT, is/VBZ, the/DT, vicious/JJ, element/NN, in/IN, the/DT, present/JJ, system/NN, ./.]

If France were divided into ten circuits , the magistracy might be reinstated by conferring its dignities on men of fortune ; but with six-and-twenty circuits this is impossible .
[If/IN, France/NNP, were/VBD, divided/VBN, into/IN, ten/CD, circuits/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, magistracy/NN, might/MD, be/VB, reinstated/VBN, by/IN, conferring/VBG, its/PRP$, dignities/NNS, on/IN, men/NNS, of/IN, fortune/NN, ;/:, but/CC, with/IN, six-and-twenty/JJ, circuits/NNS, this/DT, is/VBZ, impossible/JJ, ./.]

And public opinion in France condemns persons under suspicion , while , by an inexplicable reaction , it justifies those committed for trial .
[And/CC, public/JJ, opinion/NN, in/IN, France/NNP, condemns/VBZ, persons/NNS, under/IN, suspicion/NN, ,/,, while/IN, ,/,, by/IN, an/DT, inexplicable/JJ, reaction/NN, ,/,, it/PRP, justifies/VBZ, those/DT, committed/VBN, for/IN, trial/NN, ./.]

This , perhaps , is a result of the essentially refractory nature of the French .
[This/DT, ,/,, perhaps/RB, ,/,, is/VBZ, a/DT, result/NN, of/IN, the/DT, essentially/RB, refractory/JJ, nature/NN, of/IN, the/DT, French/JJ, ./.]

This illogical temper of the Parisian people was one of the factors which contributed to the climax of this drama ; nay , as may be seen , it was one of the most important .
[This/DT, illogical/JJ, temper/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Parisian/NNP, people/NNS, was/VBD, one/CD, of/IN, the/DT, factors/NNS, which/WDT, contributed/VBD, to/TO, the/DT, climax/NN, of/IN, this/DT, drama/NN, ;/:, nay/RB, ,/,, as/IN, may/MD, be/VB, seen/VBN, ,/,, it/PRP, was/VBD, one/CD, of/IN, the/DT, most/RBS, important/JJ, ./.]

To enter into the secret of the terrible scenes which are acted out in the examining judge 's chambers ; to understand the respective positions of the two belligerent powers , the Law and the examinee , the object of whose contest is a certain secret kept by the prisoner from the inquisition of the magistrate -- well named in prison slang , `` the curious man '' -- it must always be remembered that persons imprisoned under suspicion know nothing of what is being said by the seven or eight publics that compose _ the Public _ , nothing of how much the police know , or the authorities , or the little that newspapers can publish as to the circumstances of the crime .
[To/XX, enter/XX, into/XX, the/XX, secret/XX, of/XX, the/XX, terrible/XX, scenes/XX, which/XX, are/XX, acted/XX, out/XX, in/XX, the/XX, examining/XX, judge/XX, 's/XX, chambers/XX, ;/XX, to/XX, understand/XX, the/XX, respective/XX, positions/XX, of/XX, the/XX, two/XX, belligerent/XX, powers/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, Law/XX, and/XX, the/XX, examinee/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, object/XX, of/XX, whose/XX, contest/XX, is/XX, a/XX, certain/XX, secret/XX, kept/XX, by/XX, the/XX, prisoner/XX, from/XX, the/XX, inquisition/XX, of/XX, the/XX, magistrate/XX, --/XX, well/XX, named/XX, in/XX, prison/XX, slang/XX, ,/XX, ``/XX, the/XX, curious/XX, man/XX, ''/XX, --/XX, it/XX, must/XX, always/XX, be/XX, remembered/XX, that/XX, persons/XX, imprisoned/XX, under/XX, suspicion/XX, know/XX, nothing/XX, of/XX, what/XX, is/XX, being/XX, said/XX, by/XX, the/XX, seven/XX, or/XX, eight/XX, publics/XX, that/XX, compose/XX, _/XX, the/XX, Public/XX, _/XX, ,/XX, nothing/XX, of/XX, how/XX, much/XX, the/XX, police/XX, know/XX, ,/XX, or/XX, the/XX, authorities/XX, ,/XX, or/XX, the/XX, little/XX, that/XX, newspapers/XX, can/XX, publish/XX, as/XX, to/XX, the/XX, circumstances/XX, of/XX, the/XX, crime/XX, ./XX]

Thus , to give a man in custody such information as Jacques Collin had just received from Asie as to Lucien 's arrest , is throwing a rope to a drowning man .

He had formerly been President of a Court of the Paris circuit ; he had been raised from that position and called to be a judge in Paris -- one of the most coveted posts in the magistracy -- by the influence of the celebrated Duchesse de Maufrigneuse , whose husband , attached to the Dauphin 's person , and Colonel of a cavalry regiment of the Guards , was as much in favor with the King as she was with MADAME .

`` Ere long , having sunk into poverty through the insufficiency of the money allowed him by this actress , he seriously compromised his brother-in-law , a highly respected printer of Angouleme , by giving forged bills , for which David Sechard was arrested , during a short visit paid to Angouleme by Lucien .
