`` He has recently laid out above a million francs in repurchasing the Rubempre estates to fulfil the conditions on which he was to be allowed to marry Mademoiselle Clotilde de Grandlieu .
[``/``, He/PRP, has/VBZ, recently/RB, laid/VBN, out/RP, above/IN, a/DT, million/CD, francs/NNS, in/IN, repurchasing/VBG, the/DT, Rubempre/NNP, estates/NNS, to/TO, fulfil/VB, the/DT, conditions/NNS, on/IN, which/WDT, he/PRP, was/VBD, to/TO, be/VB, allowed/VBN, to/TO, marry/VB, Mademoiselle/NNP, Clotilde/NNP, de/IN, Grandlieu/NNP, ./.]

`` Lucien and his companion , the convict , have succeeded in keeping their footing in the face of the world longer than Coignard did , deriving their income from the prostitution of the said Esther , formerly on the register of the town . ''

Such a dowager could not fail to attract the notice of the black-robed natives of the _ Salle des Pas-Perdus _ .

Besides the briefless lawyers who sweep this hall with their gowns , and speak of the leading advocates by their Christian names , as fine gentlemen address each other , to produce the impression that they are of the aristocracy of the law , patient youths are often to be seen , hangers-on of the attorneys , waiting , waiting , in hope of a case put down for the end of the day , which they may be so lucky as to be called to plead if the advocates retained for the earlier cases should not come out in time .

A very curious study would be that of the differences between these various black gowns , pacing the immense hall in threes , or sometimes in fours , their persistent talk filling the place with a loud , echoing hum -- a hall well named indeed , for this slow walk exhausts the lawyers as much as the waste of words .

Asie had counted on the presence of these youths ; she laughed in her sleeve at some of the pleasantries she overheard , and finally succeeded in attracting the attention of Massol , a young lawyer whose time was more taken up by the _ Police Gazette _ than by clients , and who came up with a laugh to place himself at the service of a woman so elegantly scented and so handsomely dressed .

[Camusot/NNP, was/VBD, anxious/JJ, to/TO, time/VB, Jacques/NNP, Collin/NNP, 's/POS, return/NN, to/TO, coincide/VB, with/IN, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, '/POS, hour/NN, of/IN, exercise/NN, in/IN, the/DT, prison/NN, yard/NN, ;/:, but/CC, he/PRP, needed/VBD, a/DT, reply/NN, from/IN, the/DT, Governor/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, to/TO, the/DT, order/NN, he/PRP, had/VBD, given/VBN, him/PRP, in/IN, the/DT, morning/NN, ,/,, and/CC, he/PRP, rang/VBD, for/IN, the/DT, usher/NN, ./.]

The usher appeared , and told him that the porter 's wife , from the house on the Quai Malaquais , had an important document to communicate with reference to Monsieur Lucien de Rubempre .
[The/DT, usher/NN, appeared/VBD, ,/,, and/CC, told/VBD, him/PRP, that/IN, the/DT, porter/NN, 's/POS, wife/NN, ,/,, from/IN, the/DT, house/NN, on/IN, the/DT, Quai/NNP, Malaquais/NNPS, ,/,, had/VBD, an/DT, important/JJ, document/NN, to/TO, communicate/VB, with/IN, reference/NN, to/TO, Monsieur/NNP, Lucien/NNP, de/IN, Rubempre/NNP, ./.]

[``/``, Show/VB, her/PRP, in/IN, ,/,, ''/'', said/VBD, he/PRP, ./.]

`` We were so worried by the Law -- my husband and me -- the twice when it has marched into our house , that we had forgotten a letter that was lying , for Monsieur Lucien , in our chest of drawers , which we paid ten sous for it , though it was posted in Paris , for it is very heavy , sir .

[``/``, Yes/UH, ,/,, monsieur/NNP, ./., ''/'']

`` I have taken a bath ; I should have liked to send for the father confessor of the convent where I was baptized , to have confessed and washed my soul .

God must do what He will with me .
[God/NNP, must/MD, do/VB, what/WP, He/PRP, will/MD, with/IN, me/PRP, ./.]

`` But enough of all this maudlin ; for you I want to be your Esther to the last moment , not to bore you with my death , or the future , or God , who is good , and who would not be good if He were to torture me in the next world when I have endured so much misery in this .
[``/``, But/CC, enough/RB, of/IN, all/PDT, this/DT, maudlin/NN, ;/:, for/IN, you/PRP, I/PRP, want/VBP, to/TO, be/VB, your/PRP$, Esther/NN, to/TO, the/DT, last/JJ, moment/NN, ,/,, not/RB, to/TO, bore/VB, you/PRP, with/IN, my/PRP$, death/NN, ,/,, or/CC, the/DT, future/NN, ,/,, or/CC, God/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, is/VBZ, good/JJ, ,/,, and/CC, who/WP, would/MD, not/RB, be/VB, good/JJ, if/IN, He/PRP, were/VBD, to/TO, torture/VB, me/PRP, in/IN, the/DT, next/JJ, world/NN, when/WRB, I/PRP, have/VBP, endured/VBN, so/RB, much/RB, misery/JJ, in/IN, this/DT, ./.]

[The/DT, mere/JJ, thought/NN, that/IN, what/WP, has/VBZ, been/VBN, my/PRP$, great/JJ, joy/NN, may/MD, lie/VB, behind/IN, a/DT, shop/NN, window/NN, ,/,, mixed/VBN, up/RP, with/IN, the/DT, ladies/NNS, and/CC, officers/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, Empire/NN, ,/,, or/CC, a/DT, parcel/NN, of/IN, Chinese/JJ, absurdities/NNS, ,/,, is/VBZ, a/DT, small/JJ, death/NN, to/TO, me/PRP, ./.]

Destroy that picture , my sweetheart , wipe it out , never give it to any one -- unless , indeed , the gift might win back the heart of that walking , well-dressed maypole , that Clotilde de Grandlieu , who will make you black and blue in her sleep , her bones are so sharp .
[Destroy/RB, that/IN, picture/NN, ,/,, my/PRP$, sweetheart/NN, ,/,, wipe/VBP, it/PRP, out/RP, ,/,, never/RB, give/VBP, it/PRP, to/TO, any/DT, one/NN, --/:, unless/IN, ,/,, indeed/RB, ,/,, the/DT, gift/NN, might/MD, win/VB, back/RP, the/DT, heart/NN, of/IN, that/DT, walking/NN, ,/,, well-dressed/JJ, maypole/NN, ,/,, that/DT, Clotilde/NNP, de/IN, Grandlieu/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, will/MD, make/VB, you/PRP, black/JJ, and/CC, blue/JJ, in/IN, her/PRP$, sleep/NN, ,/,, her/PRP$, bones/NNS, are/VBP, so/RB, sharp/JJ, ./.]

Oh !
[Oh/UH, !/.]

to give you pleasure , or only to make you laugh , I would have stood over a brazier with an apple in my mouth to cook it for you .

-- I should have marred your home .
[--/:, I/PRP, should/MD, have/VB, marred/VBN, your/PRP$, home/NN, ./.]

`` Oh !
[``/``, Oh/UH, !/.]

that Clotilde !
[that/IN, Clotilde/NNP, !/.]

I can not understand her .
[I/PRP, can/MD, not/RB, understand/VB, her/PRP, ./.]

-- She might have been your wife , have borne your name , have never left you day or night , have belonged to you -- and she could make difficulties !
[--/:, She/PRP, might/MD, have/VB, been/VBN, your/PRP$, wife/NN, ,/,, have/VB, borne/VBN, your/PRP$, name/NN, ,/,, have/VB, never/RB, left/VBN, you/PRP, day/NN, or/CC, night/NN, ,/,, have/VB, belonged/VBN, to/TO, you/PRP, --/:, and/CC, she/PRP, could/MD, make/VB, difficulties/NNS, !/.]

Only the Faubourg Saint-Germain can do that !
[Only/RB, the/DT, Faubourg/NNP, Saint-Germain/NNP, can/MD, do/VB, that/DT, !/.]

and yet she has not ten pounds of flesh on her bones !
[and/CC, yet/RB, she/PRP, has/VBZ, not/RB, ten/CD, pounds/NNS, of/IN, flesh/NN, on/IN, her/PRP$, bones/NNS, !/.]

`` Poor Lucien !
[``/``, Poor/NNP, Lucien/VBZ, !/.]

Dear ambitious failure !
[Dear/NNP, ambitious/JJ, failure/NN, !/.]

I am thinking of your future life .
[I/PRP, am/VBP, thinking/VBG, of/IN, your/PRP$, future/JJ, life/NN, ./.]

Well , well !
[Well/UH, ,/,, well/UH, !/.]

you will more than once regret your poor faithful dog , the good girl who would fly to serve you , who would have been dragged into a police court to secure your happiness , whose only occupation was to think of your pleasures and invent new ones , who was so full of love for you -- in her hair , her feet , her ears -- your ballerina , in short , whose every look was a benediction ; who for six years has thought of nothing but you , who was so entirely your chattel that I have never been anything but an effluence of your soul , as light is that of the sun .
[you/XX, will/XX, more/XX, than/XX, once/XX, regret/XX, your/XX, poor/XX, faithful/XX, dog/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, good/XX, girl/XX, who/XX, would/XX, fly/XX, to/XX, serve/XX, you/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, would/XX, have/XX, been/XX, dragged/XX, into/XX, a/XX, police/XX, court/XX, to/XX, secure/XX, your/XX, happiness/XX, ,/XX, whose/XX, only/XX, occupation/XX, was/XX, to/XX, think/XX, of/XX, your/XX, pleasures/XX, and/XX, invent/XX, new/XX, ones/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, was/XX, so/XX, full/XX, of/XX, love/XX, for/XX, you/XX, --/XX, in/XX, her/XX, hair/XX, ,/XX, her/XX, feet/XX, ,/XX, her/XX, ears/XX, --/XX, your/XX, ballerina/XX, ,/XX, in/XX, short/XX, ,/XX, whose/XX, every/XX, look/XX, was/XX, a/XX, benediction/XX, ;/XX, who/XX, for/XX, six/XX, years/XX, has/XX, thought/XX, of/XX, nothing/XX, but/XX, you/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, was/XX, so/XX, entirely/XX, your/XX, chattel/XX, that/XX, I/XX, have/XX, never/XX, been/XX, anything/XX, but/XX, an/XX, effluence/XX, of/XX, your/XX, soul/XX, ,/XX, as/XX, light/XX, is/XX, that/XX, of/XX, the/XX, sun/XX, ./XX]

I have at any rate provided for your future by giving you all I have .

`` Come as soon as you get this letter and take what you find under my pillow , for I do not trust the people about me .
[``/``, Come/VB, as/RB, soon/RB, as/IN, you/PRP, get/VBP, this/DT, letter/NN, and/CC, take/VB, what/WP, you/PRP, find/VBP, under/IN, my/PRP$, pillow/NN, ,/,, for/IN, I/PRP, do/VBP, not/RB, trust/VB, the/DT, people/NNS, about/IN, me/PRP, ./.]

I shall go to bed , and lay myself flat in an attitude -- why not ?
[I/PRP, shall/MD, go/VB, to/TO, bed/NN, ,/,, and/CC, lay/VB, myself/PRP, flat/JJ, in/IN, an/DT, attitude/NN, --/:, why/WRB, not/RB, ?/.]

Then I shall break the little pill against the roof of my mouth , and shall not be disfigured by any convulsion or by a ridiculous position .
[Then/RB, I/PRP, shall/MD, break/VB, the/DT, little/JJ, pill/NN, against/IN, the/DT, roof/NN, of/IN, my/PRP$, mouth/NN, ,/,, and/CC, shall/MD, not/RB, be/VB, disfigured/VBN, by/IN, any/DT, convulsion/NN, or/CC, by/IN, a/DT, ridiculous/JJ, position/NN, ./.]

`` Madame de Serizy has quarreled with you , I know , because of me ; but when she hears that I am dead , you see , dear pet , she will forgive .

[Make/VB, it/PRP, up/RB, with/IN, her/PRP, ,/,, and/CC, she/PRP, will/MD, find/VB, you/PRP, a/DT, suitable/JJ, wife/NN, if/IN, the/DT, Grandlieus/NNPS, persist/VBP, in/IN, their/PRP$, refusal/NN, ./.]

To begin with , I must tell you that the hour of eleven on Monday morning , the thirteenth of May , is only the end of a long illness , which began on the day when , on the Terrace of Saint-Germain , you threw me back on my former line of life .
[To/TO, begin/VB, with/IN, ,/,, I/PRP, must/MD, tell/VB, you/PRP, that/IN, the/DT, hour/NN, of/IN, eleven/NNS, on/IN, Monday/NNP, morning/NN, ,/,, the/DT, thirteenth/NN, of/IN, May/NNP, ,/,, is/VBZ, only/RB, the/DT, end/NN, of/IN, a/DT, long/JJ, illness/NN, ,/,, which/WDT, began/VBD, on/IN, the/DT, day/NN, when/WRB, ,/,, on/IN, the/DT, Terrace/NN, of/IN, Saint-Germain/NNP, ,/,, you/PRP, threw/VBD, me/PRP, back/RB, on/IN, my/PRP$, former/JJ, line/NN, of/IN, life/NN, ./.]

The soul may be sick , as the body is .
[The/DT, soul/NN, may/MD, be/VB, sick/JJ, ,/,, as/IN, the/DT, body/NN, is/VBZ, ./.]

But the soul can not submit stupidly to suffering like the body ; the body does not uphold the soul as the soul upholds the body , and the soul sees a means of cure in the reflection which leads to the needlewoman 's resource -- the bushel of charcoal .

`` If you can prove not merely that you are not Jacques Collin and an escaped convict , but that you are in fact Don Carlos Herrera , canon of Toledo , and secret envoy of this Majesty Ferdinand VII. , '' said he , addressing the prisoner `` you will be released ; for the impartiality demanded by my office requires me to tell you that I have this moment received a letter , written by Mademoiselle Esther Gobseck , in which she declares her intention of killing herself , and expresses suspicions as to her servants , which would seem to point to them as the thieves who have made off with the seven hundred and fifty thousand francs . ''

`` Do not suppose that I am compromising myself by telling you that the sum may possibly be recovered , '' said Jacques Collin , making the judge understand that he saw his suspicions .

The reader must already have observed the extreme disproportion of the weapons in this conflict between the prisoner under suspicion and the examining judge .
[The/DT, reader/NN, must/MD, already/RB, have/VB, observed/VBN, the/DT, extreme/JJ, disproportion/NN, of/IN, the/DT, weapons/NNS, in/IN, this/DT, conflict/NN, between/IN, the/DT, prisoner/NN, under/IN, suspicion/NN, and/CC, the/DT, examining/JJ, judge/NN, ./.]

Absolute denial when skilfully used has in its favor its positive simplicity , and sufficiently defends the criminal ; but it is , in a way , a coat of mail which becomes crushing as soon as the stiletto of cross-examination finds a joint to it .
[Absolute/JJ, denial/NN, when/WRB, skilfully/NN, used/VBD, has/VBZ, in/IN, its/PRP$, favor/NN, its/PRP$, positive/JJ, simplicity/NN, ,/,, and/CC, sufficiently/RB, defends/VBZ, the/DT, criminal/JJ, ;/:, but/CC, it/PRP, is/VBZ, ,/,, in/IN, a/DT, way/NN, ,/,, a/DT, coat/NN, of/IN, mail/NN, which/WDT, becomes/VBZ, crushing/VBG, as/RB, soon/RB, as/IN, the/DT, stiletto/NN, of/IN, cross-examination/NN, finds/VBZ, a/DT, joint/NN, to/TO, it/PRP, ./.]

As soon as mere denial is ineffectual in face of certain proven facts , the examinee is entirely at the judge 's mercy .
[As/RB, soon/RB, as/IN, mere/JJ, denial/NN, is/VBZ, ineffectual/JJ, in/IN, face/NN, of/IN, certain/JJ, proven/VBN, facts/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, examinee/NN, is/VBZ, entirely/RB, at/IN, the/DT, judge/NN, 's/POS, mercy/NN, ./.]

Now , supposing that a sort of half-criminal , like Lucien , might , if he were saved from the first shipwreck of his honesty , amend his ways , and become a useful member of society , he will be lost in the pitfalls of his examination .
[Now/RB, ,/,, supposing/VBG, that/IN, a/DT, sort/NN, of/IN, half-criminal/NN, ,/,, like/IN, Lucien/NNP, ,/,, might/MD, ,/,, if/IN, he/PRP, were/VBD, saved/VBN, from/IN, the/DT, first/JJ, shipwreck/NN, of/IN, his/PRP$, honesty/NN, ,/,, amend/VB, his/PRP$, ways/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, become/VB, a/DT, useful/JJ, member/NN, of/IN, society/NN, ,/,, he/PRP, will/MD, be/VB, lost/VBN, in/IN, the/DT, pitfalls/NNS, of/IN, his/PRP$, examination/NN, ./.]

The judge has the driest possible record drawn up of the proceedings , a faithful analysis of the questions and answers ; but no trace remains of his insidiously paternal addresses or his captious remonstrances , such as this speech .
[The/DT, judge/NN, has/VBZ, the/DT, driest/JJ, possible/JJ, record/NN, drawn/VBN, up/RP, of/IN, the/DT, proceedings/NNS, ,/,, a/DT, faithful/JJ, analysis/NN, of/IN, the/DT, questions/NNS, and/CC, answers/NNS, ;/:, but/CC, no/DT, trace/NN, remains/VBZ, of/IN, his/PRP$, insidiously/RB, paternal/JJ, addresses/NNS, or/CC, his/PRP$, captious/NNS, remonstrances/NNS, ,/,, such/JJ, as/IN, this/DT, speech/NN, ./.]

The judges of the superior courts see the results , but see nothing of the means .

said Lucien .
[said/VBD, Lucien/NNP, ./.]

[``/``, Speak/VB, out/RP, ./., ''/'']

But in spite of all his persuasion and remonstrances , Lucien would say no more .
[But/CC, in/IN, spite/NN, of/IN, all/PDT, his/PRP$, persuasion/NN, and/CC, remonstrances/NNS, ,/,, Lucien/NNP, would/MD, say/VB, no/DT, more/RBR, ./.]

Reflection had come too late , as it does to all men who are the slaves of impulse .
[Reflection/NNP, had/VBD, come/VBN, too/RB, late/RB, ,/,, as/IN, it/PRP, does/VBZ, to/TO, all/DT, men/NNS, who/WP, are/VBP, the/DT, slaves/NNS, of/IN, impulse/NN, ./.]

There lies the difference between the poet and the man of action ; one gives way to feeling to reproduce it in living images , his judgement comes in after ; the other feels and judges both at once .
[There/EX, lies/VBZ, the/DT, difference/NN, between/IN, the/DT, poet/NN, and/CC, the/DT, man/NN, of/IN, action/NN, ;/:, one/PRP, gives/VBZ, way/RB, to/TO, feeling/VBG, to/TO, reproduce/VB, it/PRP, in/IN, living/VBG, images/NNS, ,/,, his/PRP$, judgement/NN, comes/VBZ, in/RP, after/IN, ;/:, the/DT, other/JJ, feels/VBZ, and/CC, judges/NNS, both/DT, at/IN, once/RB, ./.]

[Lucien/NNP, remained/VBD, pale/JJ, and/CC, gloomy/JJ, ;/:, he/PRP, saw/VBD, himself/PRP, at/IN, the/DT, bottom/NN, of/IN, the/DT, precipice/NN, ,/,, down/IN, which/WDT, the/DT, examining/JJ, judge/NN, had/VBD, rolled/VBN, him/PRP, by/IN, the/DT, apparent/JJ, candor/NN, which/WDT, had/VBD, entrapped/VBN, his/PRP$, poet/NN, 's/POS, soul/NN, ./.]

`` AT THE CONCIERGERIE , May 15th , 1830 .

`` LUCIEN CHARDON DE RUBEMPRE . ''

`` MY DEAR ABBE , -- I have had only benefits from you , and I have betrayed you .

`` You had given me full liberty , if I should find it advantageous , to destroy you by flinging you on the ground like a cigar-end ; but I have ruined you by a blunder .
[``/``, You/PRP, had/VBD, given/VBN, me/PRP, full/JJ, liberty/NN, ,/,, if/IN, I/PRP, should/MD, find/VB, it/PRP, advantageous/JJ, ,/,, to/TO, destroy/VB, you/PRP, by/IN, flinging/VBG, you/PRP, on/IN, the/DT, ground/NN, like/IN, a/DT, cigar-end/NN, ;/:, but/CC, I/PRP, have/VBP, ruined/VBN, you/PRP, by/IN, a/DT, blunder/NN, ./.]

To escape from a difficulty , deluded by a clever question from the examining judge , your son by adoption and grace went over to the side of those who aim at killing you at any cost , and insist on proving an identity , which I know to be impossible , between you and a French villain .
[To/TO, escape/VB, from/IN, a/DT, difficulty/NN, ,/,, deluded/VBN, by/IN, a/DT, clever/JJ, question/NN, from/IN, the/DT, examining/JJ, judge/NN, ,/,, your/PRP$, son/NN, by/IN, adoption/NN, and/CC, grace/NN, went/VBD, over/RP, to/TO, the/DT, side/NN, of/IN, those/DT, who/WP, aim/VBP, at/IN, killing/VBG, you/PRP, at/IN, any/DT, cost/NN, ,/,, and/CC, insist/VBP, on/IN, proving/VBG, an/DT, identity/NN, ,/,, which/WDT, I/PRP, know/VBP, to/TO, be/VB, impossible/JJ, ,/,, between/IN, you/PRP, and/CC, a/DT, French/JJ, villain/NN, ./.]

All is said .
[All/DT, is/VBZ, said/VBN, ./.]

`` Between a man of your calibre and me -- me of whom you tried to make a greater man than I am capable of being -- no foolish sentiment can come at the moment of final parting .
[``/``, Between/IN, a/DT, man/NN, of/IN, your/PRP$, calibre/NN, and/CC, me/PRP, --/:, me/PRP, of/IN, whom/WP, you/PRP, tried/VBD, to/TO, make/VB, a/DT, greater/JJR, man/NN, than/IN, I/PRP, am/VBP, capable/JJ, of/IN, being/VBG, --/:, no/DT, foolish/JJ, sentiment/NN, can/MD, come/VB, at/IN, the/DT, moment/NN, of/IN, final/JJ, parting/NN, ./.]

You hoped to make me powerful and famous , and you have thrown me into the gulf of suicide , that is all .
[You/PRP, hoped/VBD, to/TO, make/VB, me/PRP, powerful/JJ, and/CC, famous/JJ, ,/,, and/CC, you/PRP, have/VBP, thrown/VBN, me/PRP, into/IN, the/DT, gulf/NN, of/IN, suicide/NN, ,/,, that/WDT, is/VBZ, all/DT, ./.]

I have long heard the broad pinions of that vertigo beating over my head .

`` When it is God 's will , these mysterious beings may be a Moses , an Attila , Charlemagne , Mahomet , or Napoleon ; but when He leaves a generation of these stupendous tools to rust at the bottom of the ocean , they are no more than a Pugatschef , a Fouche , a Louvel , or the Abbe Carlos Herrera .

`` I am aware that , for political ends , and to quash certain secrets concerning the Cabinets of Spain and of the Tuileries , some obscure diplomatic agents tried to show that the Abbe Carlos Herrera was a forger named Jacques Collin ; but the Abbe Carlos Herrera never told me anything about the matter excepting that he was doing his best to obtain evidence of the death or of the continued existence of Jacques Collin .

The fever for suicide had given Lucien immense clearness of mind , and the swiftness of hand familiar to authors in the fever of composition .
[The/DT, fever/NN, for/IN, suicide/NN, had/VBD, given/VBN, Lucien/NNP, immense/JJ, clearness/NNS, of/IN, mind/NN, ,/,, and/CC, the/DT, swiftness/NNS, of/IN, hand/NN, familiar/JJ, to/TO, authors/NNS, in/IN, the/DT, fever/NN, of/IN, composition/NN, ./.]

The impetus was so strong within him that these four documents were all written within half an hour ; he folded them in a wrapper , fastened with wafers , on which he impressed with the strength of delirium the coat-of-arms engraved on a seal-ring he wore , and he then laid the packet very conspicuously in the middle of the floor .
[The/DT, impetus/NN, was/VBD, so/RB, strong/JJ, within/IN, him/PRP, that/IN, these/DT, four/CD, documents/NNS, were/VBD, all/RB, written/VBN, within/IN, half/PDT, an/DT, hour/NN, ;/:, he/PRP, folded/VBD, them/PRP, in/IN, a/DT, wrapper/NN, ,/,, fastened/VBN, with/IN, wafers/NNS, ,/,, on/IN, which/WDT, he/PRP, impressed/VBD, with/IN, the/DT, strength/NN, of/IN, delirium/NN, the/DT, coat-of-arms/NNS, engraved/VBN, on/IN, a/DT, seal-ring/NN, he/PRP, wore/VBD, ,/,, and/CC, he/PRP, then/RB, laid/VBD, the/DT, packet/NN, very/RB, conspicuously/JJ, in/IN, the/DT, middle/NN, of/IN, the/DT, floor/NN, ./.]

[The/DT, camp-bed/NN, is/VBZ, so/RB, firmly/RB, fixed/VBN, that/IN, it/PRP, is/VBZ, impossible/JJ, to/TO, move/VB, it/PRP, without/IN, an/DT, amount/NN, of/IN, labor/NN, that/IN, the/DT, warder/NN, would/MD, not/RB, fail/VB, to/TO, detect/VB, ,/,, for/IN, the/DT, iron-barred/JJ, peephole/NN, is/VBZ, always/RB, open/JJ, ./.]

[In/IN, the/DT, private/JJ, rooms/NNS, for/IN, which/WDT, prisoners/NNS, pay/VBP, ,/,, and/CC, in/IN, that/WDT, whither/NNP, Lucien/NNP, had/VBD, been/VBN, conveyed/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, judge/NN, 's/POS, courtesy/NN, to/TO, a/DT, young/JJ, man/NN, belonging/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, upper/JJ, ranks/NNS, of/IN, society/NN, ,/,, the/DT, movable/JJ, bed/NN, ,/,, table/NN, ,/,, and/CC, chair/NN, might/MD, serve/VB, to/TO, carry/VB, out/RP, his/PRP$, purpose/NN, of/IN, suicide/NN, ,/,, though/IN, they/PRP, hardly/RB, made/VBD, it/PRP, easy/JJ, ./.]

Still , to hang himself , a man must find a purchase , and have a sufficient space between it and the ground for his feet to find no support .

This , then , was the plan hit upon by Lucien to put himself out of the world .
[This/DT, ,/,, then/RB, ,/,, was/VBD, the/DT, plan/NN, hit/VBN, upon/RP, by/IN, Lucien/NNP, to/TO, put/VB, himself/PRP, out/RP, of/IN, the/DT, world/NN, ./.]

The boarding of the lower part of the opening , which prevented his seeing out into the yard , also hindered the warders outside from seeing what was done in the room ; but while the lower portion of the window was replaced by two thick planks , the upper part of both halves still was filled with small panes , held in place by the cross pieces in which they were set .
[The/DT, boarding/NN, of/IN, the/DT, lower/JJR, part/NN, of/IN, the/DT, opening/NN, ,/,, which/WDT, prevented/VBD, his/PRP$, seeing/VBG, out/RP, into/IN, the/DT, yard/NN, ,/,, also/RB, hindered/VBD, the/DT, warders/NNS, outside/NN, from/IN, seeing/VBG, what/WP, was/VBD, done/VBN, in/IN, the/DT, room/NN, ;/:, but/CC, while/IN, the/DT, lower/JJR, portion/NN, of/IN, the/DT, window/NN, was/VBD, replaced/VBN, by/IN, two/CD, thick/JJ, planks/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, upper/JJ, part/NN, of/IN, both/DT, halves/NNS, still/RB, was/VBD, filled/VBN, with/IN, small/JJ, panes/NNS, ,/,, held/VBN, in/IN, place/NN, by/IN, the/DT, cross/JJ, pieces/NNS, in/IN, which/WDT, they/PRP, were/VBD, set/VBN, ./.]

Standing on the table , he could look out across the yard on a magical view , which he then beheld for the first time .

The Governor of the prison , in deference to Monsieur Camusot 's request that he should deal as leniently as possible with Lucien , had led him , as we have seen , through the dark passages of the Conciergerie , entered from the dark vault opposite the Tour d'Argent , thus avoiding the exhibition of a young man of fashion to the crowd of prisoners airing themselves in the yard .

-- And those ladies know their danger quite as well as you do -- not to say better ; they will put themselves under the protection of the public prosecutor , who already sees their families unpleasantly close to the prisoner 's bench , as a consequence of the coalition between this convict and Lucien de Rubempre , betrothed to Mademoiselle de Grandlieu -- Lucien , Esther 's lover , Madame de Maufrigneuse 's former lover , Madame de Serizy 's darling .

[Monsieur/NNP, de/FW, Granville/NNP, is/VBZ, a/DT, man/NN, who/WP, does/VBZ, not/RB, live/VB, with/IN, his/PRP$, wife/NN, ;/:, for/IN, ten/CD, years/NNS, he/PRP, had/VBD, for/IN, his/PRP$, mistress/NN, a/DT, Mademoiselle/NNP, de/IN, Bellefeuille/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, bore/VBD, him/PRP, illegitimate/VBZ, children/NNS, --/:, did/VBD, n't/RB, she/PRP, ?/.]

Well , such a magistrate is no saint ; he is a man like any other ; he can be won over ; he must give a hold somewhere ; you must discover the weak spot and flatter him ; ask his advice , point out the dangers of attending the case ; in short , try to get him into the same boat , and you will be -- '' `` I ought to kiss your footprints ! ''

And indeed , as soon as the public prosecutor and Comte Octave de Bauvan had gone off with Monsieur de Serizy and his unconscious wife , the Governor , clerk , and turnkeys gathered round the gate , after letting out Monsieur Lebrun , the prison doctor , who had been called in to certify to Lucien 's death , in concert with the `` death doctor '' of the district in which the unfortunate youth had been lodging .
[And/XX, indeed/XX, ,/XX, as/XX, soon/XX, as/XX, the/XX, public/XX, prosecutor/XX, and/XX, Comte/XX, Octave/XX, de/XX, Bauvan/XX, had/XX, gone/XX, off/XX, with/XX, Monsieur/XX, de/XX, Serizy/XX, and/XX, his/XX, unconscious/XX, wife/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, Governor/XX, ,/XX, clerk/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, turnkeys/XX, gathered/XX, round/XX, the/XX, gate/XX, ,/XX, after/XX, letting/XX, out/XX, Monsieur/XX, Lebrun/XX, ,/XX, the/XX, prison/XX, doctor/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, had/XX, been/XX, called/XX, in/XX, to/XX, certify/XX, to/XX, Lucien/XX, 's/XX, death/XX, ,/XX, in/XX, concert/XX, with/XX, the/XX, ``/XX, death/XX, doctor/XX, ''/XX, of/XX, the/XX, district/XX, in/XX, which/XX, the/XX, unfortunate/XX, youth/XX, had/XX, been/XX, lodging/XX, ./XX]

In Paris , the `` death doctor '' is the medical officer whose duty it is in each district to register deaths and certify to their causes .
[In/IN, Paris/NNP, ,/,, the/DT, ``/``, death/NN, doctor/NN, ''/'', is/VBZ, the/DT, medical/JJ, officer/NN, whose/WP$, duty/NNS, it/PRP, is/VBZ, in/IN, each/DT, district/NN, to/TO, register/VB, deaths/NNS, and/CC, certify/VB, to/TO, their/PRP$, causes/NNS, ./.]

With the rapid insight for which he was known , Monsieur de Granville had judged it necessary , for the honor of the families concerned , to have the certificate of Lucien 's death deposited at the Mairie of the district in which the Quai Malaquais lies , as the deceased had resided there , and to have the body carried from his lodgings to the Church of Saint-Germain des Pres , where the service was to be held .

`` Monsieur Camusot sent for me to give evidence as to the state of the rascal 's health , and I may assure you that he is perfectly well , and could make a fortune by playing the part of Hercules in a troupe of athletes . ''

Jacques Collin , known as _ Trompe-la-Mort _ in the world of the hulks , who must henceforth be called only by his real name , had gone through terrible distress of mind since , after hearing Camusot 's order , he had been taken back to the underground cell -- an anguish such as he had never before known in the course of a life diversified by many crimes , by three escapes , and two sentences at the Assizes .

And is there not something monstrously fine in the dog-like attachment shown to the man he had made his friend by this wretch in whom were concentrated all the life , the powers , the spirit , and the passions of the hulks , who was , so to speak , their highest expression ?

And just as you watch the current flow , seeing in it a confused sheet of images , so perhaps you would like to measure the pressure exerted by social energy on the vortex called Vautrin ; to see how far away the rebellious eddy will be carried ere it is lost , and what the end will be of this really diabolical man , human still by the power of loving -- so hardly can that heavenly grace perish , even in the most cankered heart .

This wretched convict , embodying the poem that has smiled on many a poet 's fancy -- on Moore , on Lord Byron , on Mathurin , on Canalis -- the demon who has drawn an angel down to hell to refresh him with dews stolen from heaven , -- this Jacques Collin will be seen , by the reader who has understood that iron soul , to have sacrificed his own life for seven years past .

_ Trompe-la-Mort _ had realized the German superstition of a doppelganger by means of a spiritual paternity , a phenomenon which will be quite intelligible to those women who have ever truly loved , who have felt their soul merge in that of the man they adore , who have lived his life , whether noble or infamous , happy or unhappy , obscure or brilliant ; who , in defiance of distance , have felt a pain in their leg if he were wounded in his ; who if he fought a duel would have been aware of it ; and who , to put the matter in a nutshell , did not need to be told he was unfaithful to know it .

Theodore Calvi , a young Corsican , imprisoned for life at the age of eighteen for eleven murders , thanks to the influential interference paid for with vast sums , had been made the fellow convict of Jacques Collin , to whom he was chained , in 1819 and 1820 .

[The/DT, awful/JJ, experiences/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, Assize/NNP, Court/NNP, and/CC, the/DT, ``/``, last/JJ, toilet/NN, ''/'', commonly/RB, produce/VB, this/DT, dissolution/NN, of/IN, the/DT, nervous/JJ, system/NN, ,/,, even/RB, in/IN, the/DT, strongest/JJS, natures/NNS, ./.]

Then confessions are blurted by the most firmly set lips ; then the toughest hearts break ; and , strange to say , always at the moment when these confessions are useless , when this weakness as of death snatches from the man the mask of innocence which made Justice uneasy -- for it always is uneasy when the criminal dies without confessing his crime .
[Then/RB, confessions/NNS, are/VBP, blurted/JJ, by/IN, the/DT, most/RBS, firmly/RB, set/VBN, lips/NNS, ;/:, then/RB, the/DT, toughest/JJS, hearts/NNS, break/VB, ;/:, and/CC, ,/,, strange/JJ, to/TO, say/VB, ,/,, always/RB, at/IN, the/DT, moment/NN, when/WRB, these/DT, confessions/NNS, are/VBP, useless/JJ, ,/,, when/WRB, this/DT, weakness/NN, as/RB, of/IN, death/NN, snatches/VBD, from/IN, the/DT, man/NN, the/DT, mask/NN, of/IN, innocence/NN, which/WDT, made/VBD, Justice/NNP, uneasy/JJ, --/:, for/IN, it/PRP, always/RB, is/VBZ, uneasy/JJ, when/WRB, the/DT, criminal/NN, dies/VBZ, without/IN, confessing/VBG, his/PRP$, crime/NN, ./.]

[Napoleon/NNP, went/VBD, through/IN, this/DT, collapse/NN, of/IN, every/DT, human/JJ, power/NN, on/IN, the/DT, field/NN, of/IN, Waterloo/NNP, ./.]

The first two archways on that side of the yard , facing the fine Byzantine corridor -- the only vestige now of Saint-Louis ' elegant palace -- form a parlor , where the prisoners and their counsel may meet , to which the prisoners have access through a formidable gateway -- a double passage , railed off by enormous bars , within the width of the third archway .

[The/DT, hour/NN, spent/VBN, in/IN, the/DT, yard/NN, is/VBZ, the/DT, only/JJ, time/NN, when/WRB, the/DT, prisoner/NN, is/VBZ, in/IN, the/DT, open/JJ, air/NN, or/CC, the/DT, society/NN, of/IN, his/PRP$, kind/NN, ;/:, in/IN, other/JJ, prisons/NNS, those/DT, who/WP, are/VBP, sentenced/VBN, for/IN, a/DT, term/NN, are/VBP, brought/VBN, together/RB, in/IN, workshops/NNS, ;/:, but/CC, in/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, no/DT, occupation/NN, is/VBZ, allowed/VBN, ,/,, excepting/VBG, in/IN, the/DT, privileged/JJ, cells/NNS, ./.]

There the absorbing idea in every mind is the drama of the Assize Court , since the culprit comes only to be examined or to be sentenced .
[There/RB, the/DT, absorbing/JJ, idea/NN, in/IN, every/DT, mind/NN, is/VBZ, the/DT, drama/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Assize/NNP, Court/NNP, ,/,, since/IN, the/DT, culprit/NN, comes/VBZ, only/RB, to/TO, be/VB, examined/VBN, or/CC, to/TO, be/VB, sentenced/VBN, ./.]

[This/DT, yard/NN, is/VBZ, indeed/RB, terrible/JJ, to/TO, behold/VB, ;/:, it/PRP, can/MD, not/RB, be/VB, imagined/VBN, ,/,, it/PRP, must/MD, be/VB, seen/VBN, ./.]

In the first place , the assemblage , in a space forty metres long by thirty wide , of a hundred condemned or suspected criminals , does not constitute the cream of society .
[In/IN, the/DT, first/JJ, place/NN, ,/,, the/DT, assemblage/NN, ,/,, in/IN, a/DT, space/NN, forty/JJ, metres/NNS, long/RB, by/IN, thirty/CD, wide/JJ, ,/,, of/IN, a/DT, hundred/CD, condemned/NNS, or/CC, suspected/VBN, criminals/NNS, ,/,, does/VBZ, not/RB, constitute/VB, the/DT, cream/NN, of/IN, society/NN, ./.]

These creatures , belonging for the most part to the lowest ranks , are poorly clad ; their countenances are base or horrible , for a criminal from the upper sphere of society is happily , a rare exception .
[These/DT, creatures/NNS, ,/,, belonging/VBG, for/IN, the/DT, most/JJS, part/NN, to/TO, the/DT, lowest/JJS, ranks/NNS, ,/,, are/VBP, poorly/RB, clad/JJ, ;/:, their/PRP$, countenances/NNS, are/VBP, base/NN, or/CC, horrible/JJ, ,/,, for/IN, a/DT, criminal/JJ, from/IN, the/DT, upper/JJ, sphere/NN, of/IN, society/NN, is/VBZ, happily/RB, ,/,, a/DT, rare/JJ, exception/NN, ./.]

Peculation , forgery , or fraudulent bankruptcy , the only crimes that can bring decent folks so low , enjoy the privilege of the better cells , and then the prisoner scarcely ever quits it .
[Peculation/NNP, ,/,, forgery/NN, ,/,, or/CC, fraudulent/JJ, bankruptcy/NN, ,/,, the/DT, only/JJ, crimes/NNS, that/WDT, can/MD, bring/VB, decent/JJ, folks/NNS, so/RB, low/JJ, ,/,, enjoy/VBP, the/DT, privilege/NN, of/IN, the/DT, better/JJR, cells/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, then/RB, the/DT, prisoner/NN, scarcely/RB, ever/RB, quits/VBZ, it/PRP, ./.]

This promenade , bounded by fine but formidable blackened walls , by a cloister divided up into cells , by fortifications on the side towards the quay , by the barred cells of the better class on the north , watched by vigilant warders , and filled with a herd of criminals , all meanly suspicious of each other , is depressing enough in itself ; and it becomes terrifying when you find yourself the centre of all those eyes full of hatred , curiosity , and despair , face to face with that degraded crew .
[This/XX, promenade/XX, ,/XX, bounded/XX, by/XX, fine/XX, but/XX, formidable/XX, blackened/XX, walls/XX, ,/XX, by/XX, a/XX, cloister/XX, divided/XX, up/XX, into/XX, cells/XX, ,/XX, by/XX, fortifications/XX, on/XX, the/XX, side/XX, towards/XX, the/XX, quay/XX, ,/XX, by/XX, the/XX, barred/XX, cells/XX, of/XX, the/XX, better/XX, class/XX, on/XX, the/XX, north/XX, ,/XX, watched/XX, by/XX, vigilant/XX, warders/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, filled/XX, with/XX, a/XX, herd/XX, of/XX, criminals/XX, ,/XX, all/XX, meanly/XX, suspicious/XX, of/XX, each/XX, other/XX, ,/XX, is/XX, depressing/XX, enough/XX, in/XX, itself/XX, ;/XX, and/XX, it/XX, becomes/XX, terrifying/XX, when/XX, you/XX, find/XX, yourself/XX, the/XX, centre/XX, of/XX, all/XX, those/XX, eyes/XX, full/XX, of/XX, hatred/XX, ,/XX, curiosity/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, despair/XX, ,/XX, face/XX, to/XX, face/XX, with/XX, that/XX, degraded/XX, crew/XX, ./XX]

Not a gleam of gladness !
[Not/RB, a/DT, gleam/NN, of/IN, gladness/NNS, !/.]

all is gloom -- the place and the men .
[all/DT, is/VBZ, gloom/NN, --/:, the/DT, place/NN, and/CC, the/DT, men/NNS, ./.]

All is speechless -- the walls and men 's consciences .
[All/DT, is/VBZ, speechless/JJ, --/:, the/DT, walls/NNS, and/CC, men/NNS, 's/VBZ, consciences/JJ, ./.]

To these hapless creatures danger lies everywhere ; excepting in the case of an alliance as ominous as the prison where it was formed , they dare not trust each other .
[To/TO, these/DT, hapless/JJ, creatures/NNS, danger/NN, lies/VBZ, everywhere/RB, ;/:, excepting/VBG, in/IN, the/DT, case/NN, of/IN, an/DT, alliance/NN, as/RB, ominous/JJ, as/IN, the/DT, prison/NN, where/WRB, it/PRP, was/VBD, formed/VBN, ,/,, they/PRP, dare/MD, not/RB, trust/VB, each/DT, other/JJ, ./.]

A convict who meets his most familiar comrade does not know that he may not have repented and have made a confession to save his life .
[A/DT, convict/NN, who/WP, meets/VBZ, his/PRP$, most/RBS, familiar/JJ, comrade/NN, does/VBZ, not/RB, know/VB, that/IN, he/PRP, may/MD, not/RB, have/VB, repented/VBN, and/CC, have/VB, made/VBN, a/DT, confession/NN, to/TO, save/VB, his/PRP$, life/NN, ./.]

This absence of confidence , this dread of the nark , marks the liberty , already so illusory , of the prison-yard .
[This/DT, absence/NN, of/IN, confidence/NN, ,/,, this/DT, dread/NN, of/IN, the/DT, nark/NN, ,/,, marks/VBZ, the/DT, liberty/NN, ,/,, already/RB, so/RB, illusory/JJ, ,/,, of/IN, the/DT, prison-yard/NN, ./.]

The `` nark '' -LRB- in French , le Mouton or le coqueur -RRB- is a spy who affects to be sentenced for some serious offence , and whose skill consists in pretending to be a chum .
[The/DT, ``/``, nark/NN, ''/'', -LRB-/-LRB-, in/IN, French/NNP, ,/,, le/NNP, Mouton/NNP, or/CC, le/JJ, coqueur/NN, -RRB-/-RRB-, is/VBZ, a/DT, spy/NN, who/WP, affects/VBZ, to/TO, be/VB, sentenced/VBN, for/IN, some/DT, serious/JJ, offence/NN, ,/,, and/CC, whose/WP$, skill/NNS, consists/VBZ, in/IN, pretending/VBG, to/TO, be/VB, a/DT, chum/NN, ./.]

The `` chum , '' in thieves ' slang , is a skilled thief , a professional who has cut himself adrift from society , and means to remain a thief all his days , and continues faithful through thick and thin to the laws of the swell-mob .
[The/DT, ``/``, chum/NN, ,/,, ''/'', in/IN, thieves/NNS, '/POS, slang/NN, ,/,, is/VBZ, a/DT, skilled/JJ, thief/NN, ,/,, a/DT, professional/NN, who/WP, has/VBZ, cut/VBN, himself/PRP, adrift/JJ, from/IN, society/NN, ,/,, and/CC, means/VBZ, to/TO, remain/VB, a/DT, thief/NN, all/DT, his/PRP$, days/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, continues/VBZ, faithful/NN, through/IN, thick/JJ, and/CC, thin/JJ, to/TO, the/DT, laws/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, swell-mob/NN, ./.]

Crime and madness have a certain resemblance .
[Crime/NN, and/CC, madness/NN, have/VBP, a/DT, certain/JJ, resemblance/NN, ./.]

To see the prisoners of the Conciergerie in the yard , or the madmen in the garden of an asylum , is much the same thing .
[To/TO, see/VB, the/DT, prisoners/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, in/IN, the/DT, yard/NN, ,/,, or/CC, the/DT, madmen/NN, in/IN, the/DT, garden/NN, of/IN, an/DT, asylum/NN, ,/,, is/VBZ, much/RB, the/DT, same/JJ, thing/NN, ./.]

Prisoners and lunatics walk to and fro , avoiding each other , looking up with more or less strange or vicious glances , according to the mood of the moment , but never cheerful , never grave ; they know each other , or they dread each other .
[Prisoners/NNS, and/CC, lunatics/NNS, walk/VBP, to/TO, and/CC, fro/RB, ,/,, avoiding/VBG, each/DT, other/JJ, ,/,, looking/VBG, up/RP, with/IN, more/RBR, or/CC, less/RBR, strange/JJ, or/CC, vicious/JJ, glances/NNS, ,/,, according/VBG, to/TO, the/DT, mood/NN, of/IN, the/DT, moment/NN, ,/,, but/CC, never/RB, cheerful/RB, ,/,, never/RB, grave/NN, ;/:, they/PRP, know/VBP, each/DT, other/JJ, ,/,, or/CC, they/PRP, dread/VBZ, each/DT, other/JJ, ./.]

The anticipation of their sentence , remorse , and apprehension give all these men exercising , the anxious , furtive look of the insane .
[The/DT, anticipation/NN, of/IN, their/PRP$, sentence/NN, ,/,, remorse/NN, ,/,, and/CC, apprehension/NN, give/VBP, all/PDT, these/DT, men/NNS, exercising/VBG, ,/,, the/DT, anxious/JJ, ,/,, furtive/JJ, look/NN, of/IN, the/DT, insane/NN, ./.]

Only the most consummate criminals have the audacity that apes the quietude of respectability , the sincerity of a clear conscience .
[Only/RB, the/DT, most/RBS, consummate/JJ, criminals/NNS, have/VBP, the/DT, audacity/NN, that/WDT, apes/VBZ, the/DT, quietude/NN, of/IN, respectability/NN, ,/,, the/DT, sincerity/NN, of/IN, a/DT, clear/JJ, conscience/NN, ./.]

As men of the better class are few , and shame keeps the few whose crimes have brought them within doors , the frequenters of the prison-yard are for the most part dressed as workmen .
[As/IN, men/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, better/JJR, class/NN, are/VBP, few/JJ, ,/,, and/CC, shame/NN, keeps/VBZ, the/DT, few/JJ, whose/WP$, crimes/NNS, have/VBP, brought/VBN, them/PRP, within/IN, doors/NNS, ,/,, the/DT, frequenters/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, prison-yard/NN, are/VBP, for/IN, the/DT, most/JJS, part/NN, dressed/VBN, as/IN, workmen/NNS, ./.]

Blouses , long and short , and velveteen jackets preponderate .
[Blouses/NNS, ,/,, long/JJ, and/CC, short/JJ, ,/,, and/CC, velveteen/NN, jackets/NNS, preponderate/VBP, ./.]

These coarse or dirty garments , harmonizing with the coarse and sinister faces and brutal manner -- somewhat subdued , indeed , by the gloomy reflections that weigh on men in prison -- everything , to the silence that reigns , contributes to strike terror or disgust into the rare visitor who , by high influence , has obtained the privilege , seldom granted , of going over the Conciergerie .
[These/DT, coarse/JJ, or/CC, dirty/JJ, garments/NNS, ,/,, harmonizing/VBG, with/IN, the/DT, coarse/JJ, and/CC, sinister/JJ, faces/NNS, and/CC, brutal/JJ, manner/NN, --/:, somewhat/RB, subdued/VBN, ,/,, indeed/RB, ,/,, by/IN, the/DT, gloomy/JJ, reflections/NNS, that/WDT, weigh/VBP, on/IN, men/NNS, in/IN, prison/NN, --/:, everything/NN, ,/,, to/TO, the/DT, silence/NN, that/WDT, reigns/VBZ, ,/,, contributes/VBZ, to/TO, strike/VB, terror/NN, or/CC, disgust/NN, into/IN, the/DT, rare/JJ, visitor/NN, who/WP, ,/,, by/IN, high/JJ, influence/NN, ,/,, has/VBZ, obtained/VBN, the/DT, privilege/NN, ,/,, seldom/RB, granted/VBN, ,/,, of/IN, going/VBG, over/IN, the/DT, Conciergerie/NNP, ./.]

Just as the sight of an anatomical museum , where foul diseases are represented by wax models , makes the youth who may be taken there more chaste and apt for nobler and purer love , so the sight of the Conciergerie and of the prison-yard , filled with men marked for the hulks or the scaffold or some disgraceful punishment , inspires many , who might not fear that Divine Justice whose voice speaks so loudly to the conscience , with a fear of human justice ; and they come out honest men for a long time after .
[Just/XX, as/XX, the/XX, sight/XX, of/XX, an/XX, anatomical/XX, museum/XX, ,/XX, where/XX, foul/XX, diseases/XX, are/XX, represented/XX, by/XX, wax/XX, models/XX, ,/XX, makes/XX, the/XX, youth/XX, who/XX, may/XX, be/XX, taken/XX, there/XX, more/XX, chaste/XX, and/XX, apt/XX, for/XX, nobler/XX, and/XX, purer/XX, love/XX, ,/XX, so/XX, the/XX, sight/XX, of/XX, the/XX, Conciergerie/XX, and/XX, of/XX, the/XX, prison-yard/XX, ,/XX, filled/XX, with/XX, men/XX, marked/XX, for/XX, the/XX, hulks/XX, or/XX, the/XX, scaffold/XX, or/XX, some/XX, disgraceful/XX, punishment/XX, ,/XX, inspires/XX, many/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, might/XX, not/XX, fear/XX, that/XX, Divine/XX, Justice/XX, whose/XX, voice/XX, speaks/XX, so/XX, loudly/XX, to/XX, the/XX, conscience/XX, ,/XX, with/XX, a/XX, fear/XX, of/XX, human/XX, justice/XX, ;/XX, and/XX, they/XX, come/XX, out/XX, honest/XX, men/XX, for/XX, a/XX, long/XX, time/XX, after/XX, ./XX]

As the men who were exercising in the prison-yard , when _ Trompe-la-Mort _ appeared there , were to be the actors in a scene of crowning importance in the life of Jacques Collin , it will be well to depict a few of the principal personages of this sinister crowd .
[As/IN, the/DT, men/NNS, who/WP, were/VBD, exercising/VBG, in/IN, the/DT, prison-yard/NN, ,/,, when/WRB, _/NNP, Trompe-la-Mort/NNP, _/NNP, appeared/VBD, there/RB, ,/,, were/VBD, to/TO, be/VB, the/DT, actors/NNS, in/IN, a/DT, scene/NN, of/IN, crowning/JJ, importance/NN, in/IN, the/DT, life/NN, of/IN, Jacques/NNP, Collin/NNP, ,/,, it/PRP, will/MD, be/VB, well/RB, to/TO, depict/VB, a/DT, few/JJ, of/IN, the/DT, principal/JJ, personages/NNS, of/IN, this/DT, sinister/JJ, crowd/NN, ./.]

Here , as everywhere when men are thrown together , here , as at school even , force , physical and moral , wins the day .
[Here/RB, ,/,, as/RB, everywhere/RB, when/WRB, men/NNS, are/VBP, thrown/VBN, together/RB, ,/,, here/RB, ,/,, as/RB, at/IN, school/NN, even/RB, ,/,, force/NN, ,/,, physical/NN, and/CC, moral/JJ, ,/,, wins/VBZ, the/DT, day/NN, ./.]

Here , then , as on the hulks , crime stamps the man 's rank .
[Here/RB, ,/,, then/RB, ,/,, as/IN, on/IN, the/DT, hulks/NNS, ,/,, crime/NN, stamps/VBZ, the/DT, man/NN, 's/POS, rank/NN, ./.]

Those whose head is doomed are the aristocracy .
[Those/DT, whose/WP$, head/NN, is/VBZ, doomed/VBN, are/VBP, the/DT, aristocracy/NN, ./.]

The prison-yard , as may be supposed , is a school of criminal law , which is far better learned there than at the Hall on the Place du Pantheon .
[The/DT, prison-yard/NN, ,/,, as/IN, may/MD, be/VB, supposed/VBN, ,/,, is/VBZ, a/DT, school/NN, of/IN, criminal/JJ, law/NN, ,/,, which/WDT, is/VBZ, far/RB, better/RBR, learned/VBN, there/RB, than/IN, at/IN, the/DT, Hall/NNP, on/IN, the/DT, Place/NNP, du/NNP, Pantheon/NNP, ./.]

A never-failing pleasantry is to rehearse the drama of the Assize Court ; to elect a president , a jury , a public prosecutor , a counsel , and to go through the whole trial .
[A/DT, never-failing/JJ, pleasantry/NN, is/VBZ, to/TO, rehearse/VB, the/DT, drama/NN, of/IN, the/DT, Assize/NNP, Court/NNP, ;/:, to/TO, elect/VB, a/DT, president/NN, ,/,, a/DT, jury/NN, ,/,, a/DT, public/JJ, prosecutor/NN, ,/,, a/DT, counsel/NN, ,/,, and/CC, to/TO, go/VB, through/IN, the/DT, whole/JJ, trial/NN, ./.]

This hideous farce is played before almost every great trial .
[This/DT, hideous/JJ, farce/NN, is/VBZ, played/VBN, before/IN, almost/RB, every/DT, great/JJ, trial/NN, ./.]

At this time a famous case was proceeding in the Criminal Court , that of the dreadful murder committed on the persons of Monsieur and Madame Crottat , the notary 's father and mother , retired farmers who , as this horrible business showed , kept eight hundred thousand francs in gold in their house .
[At/IN, this/DT, time/NN, a/DT, famous/JJ, case/NN, was/VBD, proceeding/VBG, in/IN, the/DT, Criminal/NNP, Court/NNP, ,/,, that/DT, of/IN, the/DT, dreadful/JJ, murder/NN, committed/VBN, on/IN, the/DT, persons/NNS, of/IN, Monsieur/NNP, and/CC, Madame/NNP, Crottat/NNP, ,/,, the/DT, notary/NN, 's/POS, father/NN, and/CC, mother/NN, ,/,, retired/VBD, farmers/NNS, who/WP, ,/,, as/IN, this/DT, horrible/JJ, business/NN, showed/VBD, ,/,, kept/VBD, eight/CD, hundred/CD, thousand/CD, francs/NNS, in/IN, gold/NN, in/IN, their/PRP$, house/NN, ./.]

One of the men concerned in this double murder was the notorious Dannepont , known as la Pouraille , a released convict , who for five years had eluded the most active search on the part of the police , under the protection of seven or eight different names .
[One/CD, of/IN, the/DT, men/NNS, concerned/VBN, in/IN, this/DT, double/JJ, murder/NN, was/VBD, the/DT, notorious/JJ, Dannepont/NN, ,/,, known/VBN, as/IN, la/NNP, Pouraille/NNP, ,/,, a/DT, released/VBN, convict/NN, ,/,, who/WP, for/IN, five/CD, years/NNS, had/VBD, eluded/VBD, the/DT, most/RBS, active/JJ, search/NN, on/IN, the/DT, part/NN, of/IN, the/DT, police/NN, ,/,, under/IN, the/DT, protection/NN, of/IN, seven/CD, or/CC, eight/CD, different/JJ, names/NNS, ./.]

[This/DT, villain/NN, 's/POS, disguises/NNS, were/VBD, so/RB, perfect/JJ, ,/,, that/IN, he/PRP, had/VBD, served/VBN, two/CD, years/NNS, of/IN, imprisonment/NN, under/IN, the/DT, name/NN, of/IN, Delsouq/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, was/VBD, one/CD, of/IN, his/PRP$, own/JJ, disciples/NNS, ,/,, and/CC, a/DT, famous/JJ, thief/NN, ,/,, though/IN, he/PRP, never/RB, ,/,, in/IN, any/DT, of/IN, his/PRP$, achievements/NNS, ,/,, went/VBD, beyond/IN, the/DT, jurisdiction/NN, of/IN, the/DT, lower/JJR, Courts/NNS, ./.]

The certainty that he would be executed , not less than the large fortune he was supposed to have , made this man an object of terror and admiration to his fellow-prisoners ; for not a farthing of the stolen money had ever been recovered .

Even after the events of July 1830 , some persons may remember the terror caused in Paris by this daring crime , worthy to compare in importance with the robbery of medals from the Public Library ; for the unhappy tendency of our age is to make a murder the more interesting in proportion to the greater sum of money secured by it .
[Even/RB, after/IN, the/DT, events/NNS, of/IN, July/NNP, 1830/CD, ,/,, some/DT, persons/NNS, may/MD, remember/VB, the/DT, terror/NN, caused/VBN, in/IN, Paris/NNP, by/IN, this/DT, daring/JJ, crime/NN, ,/,, worthy/JJ, to/TO, compare/VB, in/IN, importance/NN, with/IN, the/DT, robbery/NN, of/IN, medals/NNS, from/IN, the/DT, Public/NNP, Library/NNP, ;/:, for/IN, the/DT, unhappy/JJ, tendency/NN, of/IN, our/PRP$, age/NN, is/VBZ, to/TO, make/VB, a/DT, murder/NN, the/DT, more/RBR, interesting/JJ, in/IN, proportion/NN, to/TO, the/DT, greater/JJR, sum/NN, of/IN, money/NN, secured/VBN, by/IN, it/PRP, ./.]

La Pouraille , a small , lean , dry man , with a face like a ferret , forty-five years old , and one of the celebrities of the prisons he had successively lived in since the age of nineteen , knew Jacques Collin well , how and why will be seen .
[La/NNP, Pouraille/NNP, ,/,, a/DT, small/JJ, ,/,, lean/JJ, ,/,, dry/JJ, man/NN, ,/,, with/IN, a/DT, face/NN, like/IN, a/DT, ferret/NN, ,/,, forty-five/JJ, years/NNS, old/JJ, ,/,, and/CC, one/CD, of/IN, the/DT, celebrities/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, prisons/NNS, he/PRP, had/VBD, successively/RB, lived/VBN, in/IN, since/IN, the/DT, age/NN, of/IN, nineteen/NN, ,/,, knew/VBD, Jacques/NNP, Collin/NNP, well/RB, ,/,, how/WRB, and/CC, why/WRB, will/MD, be/VB, seen/VBN, ./.]

Two other convicts , brought with la Pouraille from La Force within these twenty-four hours , had at once acknowledged and made the whole prison-yard acknowledge the supremacy of this past-master sealed to the scaffold .
[Two/CD, other/JJ, convicts/NNS, ,/,, brought/VBN, with/IN, la/NNP, Pouraille/NNP, from/IN, La/NNP, Force/NNP, within/IN, these/DT, twenty-four/JJ, hours/NNS, ,/,, had/VBD, at/IN, once/RB, acknowledged/VBN, and/CC, made/VBD, the/DT, whole/JJ, prison-yard/NN, acknowledge/VBP, the/DT, supremacy/NN, of/IN, this/DT, past-master/NN, sealed/VBN, to/TO, the/DT, scaffold/NN, ./.]

One of these convicts , a ticket-of-leave man , named Selerier , alias l'Avuergnat , Pere Ralleau , and le Rouleur , who in the sphere known to the hulks as the swell-mob was called Fil-de-Soie -LRB- or silken thread -RRB- -- a nickname he owed to the skill with which he slipped through the various perils of the business -- was an old ally of Jacques Collin 's .
[One/CD, of/IN, these/DT, convicts/NNS, ,/,, a/DT, ticket-of-leave/JJ, man/NN, ,/,, named/VBN, Selerier/NNP, ,/,, alias/JJ, l'Avuergnat/NN, ,/,, Pere/NNP, Ralleau/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, le/NNP, Rouleur/NNP, ,/,, who/WP, in/IN, the/DT, sphere/NN, known/VBN, to/TO, the/DT, hulks/NNS, as/IN, the/DT, swell-mob/NN, was/VBD, called/VBN, Fil-de-Soie/JJ, -LRB-/-LRB-, or/CC, silken/VB, thread/NN, -RRB-/-RRB-, --/:, a/DT, nickname/NN, he/PRP, owed/VBD, to/TO, the/DT, skill/NN, with/IN, which/WDT, he/PRP, slipped/VBD, through/IN, the/DT, various/JJ, perils/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, business/NN, --/:, was/VBD, an/DT, old/JJ, ally/NN, of/IN, Jacques/NNP, Collin/NNP, 's/POS, ./.]

_ Trompe-la-Mort _ so keenly suspected Fil-de-Soie of playing a double part , of being at once in the secrets of the swell-mob and a spy laid by the police , that he had supposed him to be the prime mover of his arrest in the Maison Vauquer in 1819 -LRB- _ Le Pere Goriot _ -RRB- .
[_/NNP, Trompe-la-Mort/NNP, _/NNP, so/RB, keenly/RB, suspected/VBD, Fil-de-Soie/NNP, of/IN, playing/VBG, a/DT, double/JJ, part/NN, ,/,, of/IN, being/VBG, at/IN, once/RB, in/IN, the/DT, secrets/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, swell-mob/NN, and/CC, a/DT, spy/NN, laid/VBN, by/IN, the/DT, police/NN, ,/,, that/IN, he/PRP, had/VBD, supposed/VBN, him/PRP, to/TO, be/VB, the/DT, prime/JJ, mover/NN, of/IN, his/PRP$, arrest/NN, in/IN, the/DT, Maison/NNP, Vauquer/NNP, in/IN, 1819/CD, -LRB-/-LRB-, _/NNP, Le/NNP, Pere/NNP, Goriot/NNP, _/NNP, -RRB-/-RRB-, ./.]

Selerier , whom we must call Fil-de-Soie , as we shall also call Dannepont la Pouraille , already guilty of evading surveillance , was concerned in certain well-known robberies without bloodshed , which would certainly take him back to the hulks for at least twenty years .
[Selerier/NNP, ,/,, whom/WP, we/PRP, must/MD, call/VB, Fil-de-Soie/JJ, ,/,, as/IN, we/PRP, shall/MD, also/RB, call/VB, Dannepont/NNP, la/NNP, Pouraille/NNP, ,/,, already/RB, guilty/JJ, of/IN, evading/VBG, surveillance/NN, ,/,, was/VBD, concerned/VBN, in/IN, certain/JJ, well-known/JJ, robberies/NNS, without/IN, bloodshed/NN, ,/,, which/WDT, would/MD, certainly/RB, take/VB, him/PRP, back/RP, to/TO, the/DT, hulks/NNS, for/IN, at/IN, least/JJS, twenty/CD, years/NNS, ./.]

The other convict , named Riganson , and his kept woman , known as la Biffe , were a most formidable couple , members of the swell-mob .
[The/DT, other/JJ, convict/NN, ,/,, named/VBN, Riganson/NNP, ,/,, and/CC, his/PRP$, kept/JJ, woman/NN, ,/,, known/VBN, as/IN, la/NNP, Biffe/NNP, ,/,, were/VBD, a/DT, most/RBS, formidable/JJ, couple/NN, ,/,, members/NNS, of/IN, the/DT, swell-mob/NN, ./.]

[Riganson/NNP, ,/,, on/IN, very/RB, distant/JJ, terms/NNS, with/IN, the/DT, police/NN, from/IN, his/PRP$, earliest/JJS, years/NNS, ,/,, was/VBD, nicknamed/VBN, le/NNP, Biffon/NNP, ./.]

Biffon was the male of la Biffe -- for nothing is sacred to the swell-mob .
[Biffon/NNP, was/VBD, the/DT, male/NN, of/IN, la/NNP, Biffe/NNP, --/:, for/IN, nothing/NN, is/VBZ, sacred/JJ, to/TO, the/DT, swell-mob/NN, ./.]

These fiends respect nothing , neither the law nor religions , not even natural history , whose solemn nomenclature , it is seen , is parodied by them .
[These/DT, fiends/VBZ, respect/NN, nothing/NN, ,/,, neither/CC, the/DT, law/NN, nor/CC, religions/NNS, ,/,, not/RB, even/RB, natural/JJ, history/NN, ,/,, whose/WP$, solemn/JJ, nomenclature/NN, ,/,, it/PRP, is/VBZ, seen/VBN, ,/,, is/VBZ, parodied/VBN, by/IN, them/PRP, ./.]

Here a digression is necessary ; for Jacques Collin 's appearance in the prison-yard in the midst of his foes , as had been so cleverly contrived by Bibi-Lupin and the examining judge , and the strange scenes to ensue , would be incomprehensible and impossible without some explanation as to the world of thieves and of the hulks , its laws , its manners , and above all , its language , its hideous figures of speech being indispensable in this portion of my tale .
[Here/XX, a/XX, digression/XX, is/XX, necessary/XX, ;/XX, for/XX, Jacques/XX, Collin/XX, 's/XX, appearance/XX, in/XX, the/XX, prison-yard/XX, in/XX, the/XX, midst/XX, of/XX, his/XX, foes/XX, ,/XX, as/XX, had/XX, been/XX, so/XX, cleverly/XX, contrived/XX, by/XX, Bibi-Lupin/XX, and/XX, the/XX, examining/XX, judge/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, the/XX, strange/XX, scenes/XX, to/XX, ensue/XX, ,/XX, would/XX, be/XX, incomprehensible/XX, and/XX, impossible/XX, without/XX, some/XX, explanation/XX, as/XX, to/XX, the/XX, world/XX, of/XX, thieves/XX, and/XX, of/XX, the/XX, hulks/XX, ,/XX, its/XX, laws/XX, ,/XX, its/XX, manners/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, above/XX, all/XX, ,/XX, its/XX, language/XX, ,/XX, its/XX, hideous/XX, figures/XX, of/XX, speech/XX, being/XX, indispensable/XX, in/XX, this/XX, portion/XX, of/XX, my/XX, tale/XX, ./XX]

So , first of all , a few words must be said as to the vocabulary of sharpers , pickpockets , thieves , and murderers , known as Argot , or thieves ' cant , which has of late been introduced into literature with so much success that more than one word of that strange lingo is familiar on the rosy lips of ladies , has been heard in gilded boudoirs , and become the delight of princes , who have often proclaimed themselves `` done brown '' -LRB- floue -RRB- !
[So/XX, ,/XX, first/XX, of/XX, all/XX, ,/XX, a/XX, few/XX, words/XX, must/XX, be/XX, said/XX, as/XX, to/XX, the/XX, vocabulary/XX, of/XX, sharpers/XX, ,/XX, pickpockets/XX, ,/XX, thieves/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, murderers/XX, ,/XX, known/XX, as/XX, Argot/XX, ,/XX, or/XX, thieves/XX, '/XX, cant/XX, ,/XX, which/XX, has/XX, of/XX, late/XX, been/XX, introduced/XX, into/XX, literature/XX, with/XX, so/XX, much/XX, success/XX, that/XX, more/XX, than/XX, one/XX, word/XX, of/XX, that/XX, strange/XX, lingo/XX, is/XX, familiar/XX, on/XX, the/XX, rosy/XX, lips/XX, of/XX, ladies/XX, ,/XX, has/XX, been/XX, heard/XX, in/XX, gilded/XX, boudoirs/XX, ,/XX, and/XX, become/XX, the/XX, delight/XX, of/XX, princes/XX, ,/XX, who/XX, have/XX, often/XX, proclaimed/XX, themselves/XX, ``/XX, done/XX, brown/XX, ''/XX, -LRB-/XX, floue/XX, -RRB-/XX, !/XX]

And it must be owned , to the surprise no doubt of many persons , that no language is more vigorous or more vivid than that of this underground world which , from the beginnings of countries with capitals , has dwelt in cellars and slums , in the third limbo of society everywhere -LRB- le troisieme dessous , as the expressive and vivid slang of the theatres has it -RRB- .

And it is the same in other callings which are strongly in opposition , strong contrasts with civilization .
[And/CC, it/PRP, is/VBZ, the/DT, same/JJ, in/IN, other/JJ, callings/NNS, which/WDT, are/VBP, strongly/RB, in/IN, opposition/NN, ,/,, strong/JJ, contrasts/VBZ, with/IN, civilization/NN, ./.]

These violent , eccentric , singular signs -- sui generis -- are what make the harlot , the robber , the murderer , the ticket-of-leave man , so easily recognizable by their foes , the spy and the police , to whom they are as game to the sportsman : they have a gait , a manner , a complexion , a look , a color , a smell -- in short , infallible marks about them .

Besides , a man sentenced to death is at once secured in a straitwaistcoat , a garment which precludes all use of the hands ; he is chained by one foot to his camp bed , and he has a fellow prisoner to watch and attend on him .

A man might sink under less !

-- Worn out by want of sleep , I dozed from five till half-past seven , and I had to be here by half-past eight to warrant an execution .
[--/:, Worn/NNP, out/RB, by/IN, want/VBP, of/IN, sleep/NN, ,/,, I/PRP, dozed/VBD, from/IN, five/CD, till/IN, half-past/JJ, seven/CD, ,/,, and/CC, I/PRP, had/VBD, to/TO, be/VB, here/RB, by/IN, half-past/JJ, eight/CD, to/TO, warrant/VB, an/DT, execution/NN, ./.]

Take my word for it , Monsieur Camusot , when a judge has been toiling all night in such gulfs of sorrow , feeling the heavy hand of God on all human concerns , and heaviest on noble souls , it is hard to sit down here , in front of a desk , and say in cold blood , ` Cut off a head at four o'clock !

-- This passion , like every other , had defeated its own end , for lovers who insist on adoring each other too fondly end by quarreling .

Every evil deed , however quickly it may hide its traces , is overtaken by some retribution .

In this struggle for existence , when the game is going well -- when you have quint and quartorze in your hand and the lead -- the candle tumbles over and the cards are burned , or the player has a fit of apoplexy !

Besides the forty-eight police commissioners who watch over Paris like forty-eight petty Providences , to say nothing of the guardians of Public Safety -- and who have earned the nickname of quart d'oeil , in thieves ' slang , a quarter of an eye , because there are four of them to each district , -- besides these , there are two commissioners attached equally to the police and to the legal authorities , whose duty it is to undertake delicate negotiation , and not frequently to serve as deputies to the examining judges .

The office of these two magistrates , for police commissioners are also magistrates , is known as the Delegates ' office ; for they are , in fact , delegated on each occasion , and formally empowered to carry out inquiries or arrests .
[The/DT, office/NN, of/IN, these/DT, two/CD, magistrates/NNS, ,/,, for/IN, police/NN, commissioners/NNS, are/VBP, also/RB, magistrates/NNS, ,/,, is/VBZ, known/VBN, as/IN, the/DT, Delegates/NNPS, '/POS, office/NN, ;/:, for/IN, they/PRP, are/VBP, ,/,, in/IN, fact/NN, ,/,, delegated/VBD, on/IN, each/DT, occasion/NN, ,/,, and/CC, formally/RB, empowered/VBN, to/TO, carry/VB, out/RP, inquiries/NNS, or/CC, arrests/NNS, ./.]

These functions demand men of ripe age , proved intelligence , great rectitude , and perfect discretion ; and it is one of the miracles wrought by Heaven in favor of Paris , that some men of that stamp are always forthcoming .
